Qalamoun|work=All4Syria|date=10 September 2016}} | casualties3 = | notes = | campaignbox = {{Campaignbox Syrian uprising}} {{Campaignbox Rif Dimashq Campaign}} }} The '''Eastern Qalamoun offensive''' was a large-scale [[military offensive]] against [[Syrian rebel]] positions in the eastern [[Qalamoun Mountains]] of the [[Rif Dimashq Governorate]] launched by the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]] along a frontline of more than 15 kilometers in the region. ==The offensive== On 3 September 2016, ISIL sent two [[car bomb]]s towards rebel positions in the mountains, but both destroyed before they could reach their targets. Following this, ISIL forces stormed the rebel-held territory from three different axis, overrunning several positions and reportedly killing more than 20 rebels. Three days later, an ISIL convoy was deployed as they launched a second assault in the area. During the clashes, the rebels destroyed an ISIL [[T-72]], a [[bulldozer]], and a [[ZU-23-2]], the latter with a [[BGM-71 TOW]] missile.{{cite web|url=http://aranews.org/2016/09/%D8%AF%D8%A7%D8%B9%D8%B4-%D9%8A%D8%AA%D9%82%D8%AF%D9%85-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%82%D9%84%D9%85%D9%88%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B4%D8%B1%D9%82%D9%8A-%D8%A8%D8%B9%D8%AF-%D9%88%D8%B5%D9%88%D9%84-%D8%AA/|title=Daesh bid to take eastern Qalamoun|work=ARA News|date=7 September 2016}} The next day, [[Jaysh al-Islam]] recaptured a hill near [[Dumayr]] from ISIL.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/jaysh-al-islam-recaptures-mountaintop-eastern-qalamoun/|title=Jaysh Al-Islam recaptures mountaintop in eastern Qalamoun|work=Al-Masdar News|date=7 September 2016}} On 9 September, ISIL launched a third attack against rebel forces in the mountains. Rebels led by [[Jaysh al-Islam]] and various [[Free Syrian Army]] factions repelled the assault and dozens of ISIL fighters were killed. Hundreds of rebel reinforcements reportedly arrived to the region the next day. On 13 September, ISIL recaptured the three hilltops of Jabal Zubaydi, Tall Daba'a and Jabal al-Afa'i.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/isis-snatches-swaths-rebel-territory-northeast-damascus-map-update/|title=ISIS snatches swaths of rebel territory northeast of Damascus – Map update|work=Al-Masdar News|date=14 September 2016}} On 14–15 September, rebels launched a counter-attack to regain Jabal al-Afa'i.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=50657|title=Rebels clash with IS and regime forces in Reef Dimashq|work=SOHR|date=15 September 2016}} On 17–18 September, ISIL forces launched a successful assault against rebel positions at Badiya, killing four and capturing forty defenders,{{cite web|url=https://syria.liveuamap.com/en/2016/18-september-e-qalamoun--isis-attacked-jfs-positions-in-the|title=E. Qalamoun : ISIS attacked JFS positions in the Badiya where four were killed and another forty were taken prisoner.|date=18 September 2016}} while losing two vehicles in return.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=50753|title=Clashes in the Eastern Qalamoun and raids in the west of Rif Dimashq|work=SOHR|date=17 September 2016}} Heavy fighting between rebels and ISIL in the area was reported on 19 September, as the ISIL offensive entered its 3rd week.{{cite web|url=https://syria.liveuamap.com/en/2016/19-september-eastern-qalamoun-heavy-clashes-continue-with|title=Eastern Qalamoun: heavy clashes continue with Rebels as ISIS offensive enters its 3rd week.|date=19 September 2016}} On 21 September, [[Ahrar al-Sham]] and the [[Forces of Martyr Ahmad al-Abdo]] recaptured the Rajem al-A'ali area, giving them the control of 40% of the al-Afa'i Mountains, while a [[Syrian Air Force]] [[MiG-23]] targeting ISIL crashed in the region.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/isis-downs-new-syrian-jet-rebels-advance-eastern-qalamoun/|title=ISIS downs new Syrian jet while rebels advance in Eastern Qalamoun|author=Chris Tomson|work=Al-Masdar News|date=21 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.qasioun.net/en/news/show/37548/Opposition_Progressing_In_Qalamon_Against_ISIS_%E2%80%A6_The_Latter_Drop_A_Regime_Warplane_In_The_Area|title=Opposition Progressing In Qalamon Against ISIS … The Latter Drop A Regime Warplane In The Area|work=Qasioun News|date=21 September 2016}} Rebel forces made further progress later that day, retaking several positions at Jebal Batra.{{cite web|url=https://syria.liveuamap.com/en/2016/21-september-eastern-qalamoun-rebels-expelled-isis-from-several|title=Eastern Qalamoun: Rebels expelled ISIS from several positions in Jebal Batra.|date=21 September 2016}} The pilot of the crashed government jet landed in rebel territory in the mountains and as a result of a truce in the area, the rebels handed him over to the [[Syrian Armed Forces]] and reportedly received [[small arms]] and [[ammunition]] from government forces in return. By 23 September, the rebels were in control of 70% of Jabal al-Afa'i.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/video-al-qaeda-linked-group-pushes-isis-held-syrian-territory/|title=VIDEO: Al-Qaeda linked group pushes through ISIS-held Syrian territory|author=Chris Tomson|work=Al-Masdar News|date=23 September 2016}} On 26 September, unknown gunmen attempted to assassinate Harith Siwar, commander of [[Jaysh al-Islam]] in the Eastern Qalamoun Mountains. On 29 September, ISIL forces launched a new attack in the eastern Qalamoun Mountains, leading to heavy clashes with the rebel defenders.{{cite web|url=http://www.qasioun.net/en/news/show/38195/Clashes_between_ISIS_and_opposition_forces_in_Qalamoun|title=Clashes between ISIS and opposition forces in Qalamoun |work=Qasioun News|date=29 September 2016}} In the night of 1–2 October, ISIL fighters stormed eastern Jabal al-Afa'i amid heavy fighting with FSA forces.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/isis-launches-new-offensive-eastern-qalamoun/|title=ISIS launches new offensive in eastern Qalamoun|author=Leith Fadel|work=Al-Masdar News|date=2 October 2016}} Two days later, Jaysh al-Islam repelled another major ISIL attack on Jabal al-Afa'i and al-Naqab.{{cite web|url=http://en.eldorar.com/node/3416|title=Jaysh al-Islam repels the #ISIS Group’ attack in Qalamoun and kills many militants|author=Leith Fadel|work=El-Dorar Al-Shamia|date=4 October 2016}} On 9 October, 12 ISIL fighters and an unknown number of rebels were killed in clashes after an attack by ISIL on al-Khandaq and al-Naqab mountain.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=51959|title=Continued clashes between rebels and IS in Qalamoun|date=9 October 2016}} Five rebels were killed in clashes on the following day.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=51999|title=5 casualties in clashes against the 'Islamic state' in the eastern Qalamoun and exchange of targeting in Homs}} On 15 October, rebels launched an assault on Kahil Tes and Mahol areas.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=52427|title=Clashes breakout between rebels and IS in Qalamon|date=15 October 2016}} ==Aftermath== {{seealso|2017 Southern Syrian Desert offensive}} On 26 October, Syrian military bombarded areas under ISIL control in the region.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=53257|title=Continued clashes in al-Rayhan area in Reef Dimashq|date=26 October 2016}} On 2 November, clashes renewed between ISIL and rebels, concentrated in the area of Jabal al-Afa'i.{{cite news|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=53789|title= Clashes continue in the Western Ghouta and renewed in the eastern Qalamoun|work=SOHR|date=2 November 2016}} On 6 November, the rebels launched their own offensive,{{cite news|url=http://syriadirect.org/news/with-all-eyes-on-raqqa-us-backed-rebels-take-on-the-islamic-state-in-syria%E2%80%99s-mountains/|title= With all eyes on Raqqa, US-backed rebels take on the Islamic State in Syria’s mountains|work=Syria Direct|date=10 November 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://aranews.net/2016/11/islamic-state-loses-ground-syrian-rebels-damascus-suburb/|title= Islamic State loses ground to Syrian rebels in Damascus suburb|work=ARA News|date=6 November 2016}} attacking ISIL positions. The rebels stated they had captured three checkpoints, with 7 ISIL fighters and 4 rebels being killed in the clashes. With the recent advances, rebels broke the siege imposed by ISIL on them in the region and had started advancing northwards to retake territory previously captured by the group. On 29 December, FSA forces launched [[2017 Southern Syrian Desert offensive|an offensive]] toward ISIL lines in the eastern Qalamoun and captured five villages.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/free-syrian-army-launches-large-scale-offensive-east-qalamoun/|title=Free Syrian Army launches large-scale offensive in east Qalamoun|work=Al-Masdar News|date=29 December 2016}} ==See also== *[[Al-Dumayr offensive (April 2016)]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Syrian Civil War}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Eastern Qalamoun offensive (September-October 2016)}} [[Category:Conflicts in 2016]] [[Category:Damascus in the Syrian Civil War]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War in 2016]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Syrian government]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Free Syrian Army]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving Jabhat Fateh al-Sham]] [[Category:September 2016 events in Asia]] [[Category:October 2016 events in Asia]]

'''Eufranio "Franny" Chan Eriguel, M.D.''' (June 12, 1959 – May 12, 2018) was a Filipino medical doctor and politician from the Eriguel [[Political dynasties in the Philippines|political clan]] of [[La Union]],<ref name="Term2013"/><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.bomboradyo.com/news/top-stories/item/3559-political-dynasty-sa-la-union-namayagpag-muli|title=Political Dynasty sa La Union Namayagpag Muli|last=|first=|date=18 May 2013|newspaper=|access-date=28 March 2014|publisher=Bombo Radyo Philippines|work=bomboradyo.com|via=}}{{dead link|date=March 2018|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.pressreader.com/philippines/philippine-daily-inquirer/20100512/282909496743143|title=GMA, Pacman, Imelda win; Jocjoc, Ermita, Montano losing|last=|first=|date=2010-05-12|newspaper=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|access-date=14 February 2017|work=|via=}}</ref> who was gunned down in an ambush on 12 May 2018.<ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/regions/653172/former-la-union-congressman-shot-dead/story/|title=Former La Union congressman, 2 bodyguards shot dead|work=GMA News Online|access-date=2018-05-12|language=en-US}}</ref>
Eriguel served three terms as Mayor of [[Agoo, La Union]]<ref name="LBPvCacayuran">{{cite court|litigants=Land Bank Of The Philippines, Petitioner, V. Eduardo M. Cacayuran, Respondent, Municipality Of Agoo, La Union, Intervenor. |vol= G.R. No. 191667 |reporter= |opinion= |pinpoint=|court= | date=2015-04-22 |url=http://www.chanrobles.com/cralaw/2015aprildecisions.php?id=302 |accessdate=2017-02-14 |quote= |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170214000000/http://www.chanrobles.com/cralaw/2015aprildecisions.php?id=302 |archivedate=2017-02-14}}</ref> and two terms as Congressman for the Second District of La Union.<ref name="NPhilTimes">{{Cite news|url=http://northphiltimes.blogspot.com/2010/04/sc-affirms-former-agoo-mayor-guilty-in.html|title=Supreme Court affirms former Agoo mayor guilty in loan scam|last=|first=|date=2010-04-26|newspaper=Northern Philippines Times|access-date=2015-02-20|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170224055653/http://northphiltimes.blogspot.com/2010/04/sc-affirms-former-agoo-mayor-guilty-in.html|archive-date=2017-02-24|dead-url=No|work=|via=}}</ref> His wife Sandra Young Eriguel<ref name="Term2013">{{Cite news|url=http://www.philstar.com:8080/election-2013/news/2013/05/26/946278/la-union-politics-eriguels-keep-posts|title=La Union Politics: Eriguels Keep Posts|last=Elias|first=Jun|date=26 May 2013|newspaper=[[The Philippine Star]]|access-date=14 February 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170220080409/http://www.philstar.com:8080/election-2013/news/2013/05/26/946278/la-union-politics-eriguels-keep-posts|archive-date=2017-02-20|dead-url=No|work=|via=}}</ref> (widow) currently serves as Congressman for the Second District of La Union, while his daughter Stefanie Ann Eriguel currently serves as Mayor of Agoo.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://pia.gov.ph/news/articles/3151457087475|title=In La Union, more women set sights on mayoralty seats|last=Sabado|first=Joanna|date=18 March 2016|publisher=Philippine Information Agency|access-date=2017-02-14|work=|issue=3|volume=1|via=}}</ref>
Eriguel is notable for his involvement in the landmark "''Land Bank of the Philippines v. Cacayuran''" case,<ref name="LBPvCacayuran" /><ref name="NPhilTimes" /> in which the construction of a commercial building within the premises of the town plaza,<ref name="LBPvCacayuran" /><ref name="NPhilTimes" /> which the Philippine Supreme court later ruled to be "irregular,"<ref name="LBPvCacayuran" /> although the court later granted a motion for reconsideration regarding the case on May 15, 2015 because the Municipality of Agoo had not been impleaded in the original case. <ref>http://www.lawphil.net/judjuris/juri2013/apr2013/gr_191667_2013.html</ref>
He later received wide media attention in 2016 when he was included by Philippine President [[Rodrigo Duterte]] as one of the [[Rodrigo Duterte speech during a wake visit to killed-in-action NavForEastMin soldiers, August 2016#Speech|local government officials and legislators allegedly involved in illegal drug trade]]<ref name="philstar">{{cite web|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2016/08/07/1611020/full-text-dutertes-speech-linking-government-officials-illegal-drugs|title=FULL TEXT: Duterte’s speech linking government officials to illegal drugs|first=|date=August 7, 2016|website=|publisher=[[The Philippine Star]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160921222401/http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2016/08/07/1611020/full-text-dutertes-speech-linking-government-officials-illegal-drugs|archive-date=2016-09-21|dead-url=No|author=|accessdate=August 24, 2016}}</ref> in his August 16 "''[[I am sorry for my country]]''" speech<ref name="rappler">{{cite web|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/142203-duterte-names-judges-cops-military-lgu-officials-linked-drugs|title=Duterte names officials linked to drugs|last=|first=|date=7 August 2016|website=|publisher=[[Rappler]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170209075649/http://www.rappler.com/nation/142203-duterte-names-judges-cops-military-lgu-officials-linked-drugs|archive-date=2017-02-09|dead-url=No|accessdate=24 August 2016}}</ref><ref name="abs">{{cite web|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/focus/08/07/16/full-transcript-dutertes-expos-vs-drug-tagged-officials|title=FULL TRANSCRIPT: Duterte's exposé vs drug-tagged officials|last=|first=|date=7 August 2016|website=|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170206174428/http://news.abs-cbn.com/focus/08/07/16/full-transcript-dutertes-expos-vs-drug-tagged-officials|archive-date=2017-02-06|dead-url=|accessdate=24 August 2016}}</ref> - an allegation which he and other La Union politicians denied.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/143012-illegal-drugs-mayors-affidavit|archive-date=February 16, 2017|title='Narco mayors': Politics behind supposed links to illegal drugs|last=|first=|date=|newspaper=Rappler|access-date=2017-02-16|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170216210250/http://www.rappler.com/nation/143012-illegal-drugs-mayors-affidavitarchive-date=2017-02-16|dead-url=|work=|language=en|via=}}</ref>
On April 2017, Eriguel's name was removed the drug list and the original inclusion was said to be politically colored because rival politicians allegedly provided the list to President Duterte.<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=http://www.manilatimes.net/3-la-union-officials-drug-list-cleared/320463/|title=3 La Union officials in drug list cleared - The Manila Times Online|website=www.manilatimes.net|language=en-US|access-date=2018-05-13}}</ref> Eriguel, who had been a founding force in former Vice President [[Jejomar Binay]]'s [[United Nationalist Alliance]], was sworn into the ruling [[PDP–Laban]] party by Speaker [[Pantaleon Alvarez]].
Eriguel and two others were gunned down in an ambush on 12 May 2018.<ref name=":2" /> He had earlier survived a bombing incident<ref name="BinayAttack">{{Cite news|url=http://interaksyon.com/article/127137/binay-supporter-eriguel-survives-attack-in-san-fernando-la-union|title=Binay supporter Eriguel survives attack in San Fernando, La Union|last=|first=|date=2016-04-30|work=|newspaper=InterAksyon.com|access-date=2017-02-16|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170216131538/http://interaksyon.com/article/127137/binay-supporter-eriguel-survives-attack-in-san-fernando-la-union|archive-date=2017-02-16|dead-url=Yes|language=en-US|via=}}</ref> during the campaign period for the [[Philippine general election, 2016|2016 General Election]].<ref name="BinayAttack" />
== Early life == Eriguel completed a pre-medical course at the [[University of Santo Tomas]], which he completed in 1979, receiving a Bachelor of Science degree (BS General / Pre-med). He completed his studies in medicine at the University of Santo Tomas in 1983.
== Mayor of Agoo == Eriguel became Mayor of Agoo on 1 July 1998 and held this office until 30 June 2007.<ref name="CongressProfile">{{cite web|url=http://www.congress.gov.ph/members/search.php?id=XX-e|title=Profile: XXl, MD|publisher=House of Representatives of the Philippines|work=Webpage, House of Representatives of the Philippines|accessdate=2016-04-16}}</ref> Through his leadership, Agoo reaped regional and national awards: Hall of Fame Awardee as the Cleanest, Safest and Greenest Municipality - 1st to 3rd Class Municipality Category (Gawad Pangulo sa Kapaligiran)Regional and National Level<ref>http://archives.pia.gov.ph/?m=12&sec=reader&rp=2&fi=p040910.htm&no=13&date=09/10/2004</ref>, Best LGU (1st - 3rd Class Municipality Category) in Literacy Promotion (2-time National and Regional Champion) <ref>http://www.philstar.com/good-news/512623/la-union-town-bags-unesco-deped-awards-literacy</ref>, and other numerous local awards in different fields of local governance.
=== Town Plaza commercialization and other events === During his term as Mayor of Agoo, Eriguel was instrumental in the construction of a commercial building within the premises of the town plaza <ref name="LBPvCacayuran" /><ref name="NPhilTimes" /> - a redevelopment which the Philippine Supreme court later ruled to be "irregular"<ref name="LBPvCacayuran" /> in its landmark "Land Bank of the Philippines v. Cacayuran" ruling.<ref name="LBPvCacayuran" /><ref name="NPhilTimes" /><ref name="Times 2013" /> The decision "penalizes abusive municipal officials"<ref name="NPhilTimes" /> even beyond their terms, so it is considered a “landmark” case in Philippine Jurisprudence.<ref name="NPhilTimes" /> However, the court later granted a motion for reconsideration regarding the case on May 15, 2015 because the Municipality of Agoo had not been impleaded in the original case..<ref>http://sc.judiciary.gov.ph/pdf/web/viewer.html?file=/jurisprudence/2015/april2015/191667.pdf</ref>
Another redevelopment which took place during Eriguel's term as Mayor of Agoo was the partial conversion of the [[Museo de Iloko]] into a franchise of fastfood giant Chowking.<ref name="Times 2013">{{cite web|url=http://www.manilatimes.net/newly-re-elected-congressman-faces-sins-of-the-past/9305/|title=Newly re-elected congressman faces sins of the past|last=|first=|date=June 12, 2013|publisher=The Manila Times|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170224054944/http://www.manilatimes.net/newly-re-elected-congressman-faces-sins-of-the-past/9305/|archive-date=2017-02-24|dead-url=No|work=Op-Ed|accessdate=30 September 2014}}</ref> The Don Eufemio F. Eriguel Memorial National High School, named after Eriguel's father, was also established during his term.
After a nine-year tenure, he had reached the maximum term limit 30 June 2007, and could no longer run for the position mayor of Agoo.<ref name="CongressProfile" /> His wife Sandra Young Eriguel won as Mayor on May 15, 2007. Eriguel was then appointed as an adviser to the government of the province of La Union for municipal affairs - a post he held until June 30, 2010.<ref name="CongressProfile"/>
== Congressman for the Second District of La Union == In the elections of May 10, 2010, Eriguel was elected as a member of the House of Representatives as a candidate for the Nationalist People’s Coalition (NPC), representing the 2nd District of La Union.<ref name="CongressProfile" /> During his term as Congressman for the Second District of La Union, Eriguel served as chair of the [[List of Philippine House of Representatives committees|House Committee on Health]],<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://thestandard.com.ph/news/-main-stories/top-stories/189773/marijuana-bill-gets-new-boost.html|title=Marijuana bill gets new boost|last=Cruz|first=Maricel|date=2015-10-18|newspaper=Manila Standard|access-date=2017-02-14|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170220080939/http://thestandard.com.ph/news/-main-stories/top-stories/189773/marijuana-bill-gets-new-boost.html|archive-date=2017-02-20|dead-url=|work=|language=en|via=}}</ref> and was among the members of the bicameral committee that passed the Graphic Health Warning bill.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://newvois.org/graphic-health-warning-bill-passes-final-reading-in-congress/|title=Graphic health warning bill passes final reading in Congress|date=2014-06-10|newspaper=New Vois Association of the Philippines|access-date=2017-02-16|language=en-US}}</ref>
=== Agoo-Aringay cityhood proposal === On June 11, 2014, Eriguel filed House Bill 4644 in an attempt to create a new city in the Second District of La Union by merging the municipalities of Agoo and Aringay.<ref name="AgooAringayBalita">{{Cite news|url=http://balita.net.ph/2014/08/23/agoo-aringay-merger-mariing-tinututulan/|title=Agoo-Aringay merger, mariing tinututulan|last=Lazaro|first=Freddie G.|date=2014-08-23|newspaper=Balita|access-date=2017-02-14|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170220053637/http://balita.net.ph/2014/08/23/agoo-aringay-merger-mariing-tinututulan/|archive-date=2017-02-20|dead-url=No|work=|via=}}</ref> The bill was co-authored by Eriguel's allies, La Union first district Rep. Victor Ortega and Abono party-list Rep. Francisco Emmanuelle Ortega III.<ref name="AgooAringayBalita" />
The bill would have created the "City of Agoo-Aringay", would have two districts under a city mayor and city vice mayor along with 14 councilors in the Sangguniang Panlungsod,<ref name="AgooAringayBalita" /> all of which were "new" positions for which the former municipal officials could run despite having finished the terms limits of their offices.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Capuno|first=Joseph J.|year=2013|title=Fiscal transfers and gerrymandering under decentralization in the Philippines|url=https://www.econstor.eu/bitstream/10419/93566/1/747317917.pdf|journal=UP School of Economics Discussion Papers|volume=2013-4|pages=|via=}}</ref>
=== Bombing === Eriguel's caravan was involved in a bombing incident, believed to be an assassination attempt, on April 30, 2016 in Agoo, La Union. The incident claimed the life of his driver-supporter, Mr. Jiovannie “Dalmas” Cacayuran and seriously injured eight (8) other individuals including his Aide, Mr. Samuel Ofiaza who lost his right eye. Mr. Cacayuran was only 31 years old and he is survived by his wife and an eight-year old son. <ref>http://northboundasia.com/2016/05/22/p1-m-reward-la-union-bomb-suspect/</ref>
=== Temporary inclusion in President Duterte's narco-politicians list === On August 16, 2016, Eriguel was included by Philippine President [[Rodrigo Duterte]] as one of the [[Rodrigo Duterte speech during a wake visit to killed-in-action NavForEastMin soldiers, August 2016#Speech|local government officials and legislators allegedly involved in illegal drug trade]]<ref name="philstar" /> in his "''[[I am sorry for my country]]''" speech.<ref name="rappler" /><ref name="abs" /> Eriguel and other La Union politicians denied these allegations.<ref name=":0" /> In the last part of March 2017, Eriguel and three other La Union politicians were removed from the narco-politician list.<ref>http://northboundasia.com/2017/03/28/3-la-union-narco-politicians-cleared-illegal-drugs-link/</ref><ref>https://www.rappler.com/nation/143012-illegal-drugs-mayors-affidavit</ref> A Manila Times news report quoted sources who said that the inclusion of Eriguel in narco-politician list was politically motivated as there are several personalities close to those in charge of providing the list to the President who have taken advantage of the situation to include the names of their rival politicians.<ref name=":3" />
On June 17, 2018, Eriguel, who had been a founding force in former Vice President [[Jejomar Binay]]'s [[United Nationalist Alliance]], was sworn into the ruling [[PDP–Laban]] party by Speaker [[Pantaleon Alvarez]].
== Death == On 12 May 2018, Eriguel and two others were gunned down by unknown assailants in an ambush during an event for the 2018 Barangay elections.<ref name=":2" />

{{short description|staged attack by Nazi forces to begin the invasion of Poland in 1939}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{Infobox operational plan | name = Gleiwitz incident | partof = [[Operation Himmler]] | image = Glivice radio tower.JPG |image_size = 300px | caption = The historic [[Gliwice Radio Tower]] in 2012, the tallest wooden structure in Europe. | type = [[Special operations]] | location = [[Gliwice|Gleiwitz, Upper Silesia]] | map_type = Germany 1937 | coordinates = {{coord|50.313370|18.689037|format=dms|display=inline,title}} | map_size = 200 | map_caption = Location of the Gleiwitz radio tower in Nazi Germany (1937 borders) | map_label = Gleiwitz Radio Tower | planned = | planned_by = | objective = Pretext for the [[invasion of Poland]] | target = | date = {{Start date|1939|08|31|df=y}} | executed_by = [[Schutzstaffel|German SS]] | outcome = }}
The '''Gleiwitz incident''' ({{lang-de|link=no|Überfall auf den Sender Gleiwitz}}; {{Lang-pl|Prowokacja gliwicka}}) was a covert Nazi German attack on the German radio station ''Sender Gleiwitz'' on the night of 31 August 1939 (today [[Gliwice]], Poland). The attack is widely regarded as a deceitful [[false flag]] operation, staged with some two dozen similar German incidents on the eve of the [[invasion of Poland]] leading up to [[European theatre of World War II|World War II in Europe]].<ref name="books">{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/?hl=en&q=Gleiwitz+casus+belli |title=Gleiwitz casus belli |publisher=Google Books |quote=Nazi government under Hitler's leadership staged the Gleiwitz incident as a casus belli for the invasion of Poland the following morning |year=2018}}</ref> The attackers had been posed as [[Second Polish Republic|Polish]] nationals. Adolf Hitler invaded Poland the next morning after a lengthy period of preparations. During his declaration of war, Hitler did not mention the Gleiwitz incident but grouped all provocations staged by the SS as an alleged Polish assault on Germany. The Gleiwitz incident is the best-known action of [[Operation Himmler]], a series of [[special operations]] undertaken by the ''[[Schutzstaffel]]'' (SS) to serve [[Nazi German]] propaganda at the outbreak of war. The operation was intended to create the appearance of Polish aggression against Germany to justify the invasion of Poland. Evidence for the Gleiwitz attack by the SS was provided by the German SS officer, Alfred Naujocks in 1945.<ref name="books"/>
==Events at Gleiwitz== [[File:Alfred Naujocks.jpg|thumb|upright|left|[[Alfred Naujocks]], who organised and led the Gleiwitz operation on the orders of the [[Gestapo]]]] Much of what is known about the Gleiwitz incident comes from the [[affidavit]] of ''SS-Sturmbannführer'' [[Alfred Naujocks]] at the [[Nuremberg Trials]]. In his testimony, he stated that he organised the incident under orders from [[Reinhard Heydrich]] and [[Heinrich Müller (Gestapo)|Heinrich Müller]], chief of the [[Gestapo]].<ref name="Nuremberg"/> On the night of 31 August 1939, a small group of German operatives dressed in Polish uniforms and led by Naujocks seized the Gleiwitz station and broadcast a short [[anti-German sentiment|anti-German]] message in Polish (sources vary on the content of the message).<ref name="Ailsby"/> The operation was named "''Grossmutter gestorben''" (Grandmother died).<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/history/world-war-two/6106566/World-War-IIs-first-victim.html The World War II's first victim. A farmer was murdered as part of a Nazi plot to provide an excuse to invade Poland, the story of a man forgotten by history.] By Bob Graham, 29 Aug 2009. The Telegraph.</ref> The operation was to make the attack and the broadcast look like the work of Polish anti-German saboteurs.<ref name="Ailsby"/><ref name="WirtzGordon"/>
[[File:Bundesarchiv Bild 146-1972-039-26, Reinhard Heydrich im Prager Schloß crop.jpg|thumb|upright|[[Heydrich]] (left) with [[Karl Hermann Frank]] at [[Prague Castle]] in 1941]] To make the attack seem more convincing, the Germans murdered Franciszek Honiok, a 43-year-old unmarried German [[Silesians|Silesian]] Catholic farmer, known for sympathising with the Poles. He had been arrested the previous day by the [[Gestapo]] and dressed to look like a [[saboteur]], then killed by [[lethal injection]], given gunshot wounds. Honiok was left dead at the scene so that he appeared to have been killed while attacking the station. His corpse was then presented to the police and press as proof of the attack.<ref name="Franciszek Honiok"/> Several prisoners from the [[Dachau concentration camp]] were drugged, shot dead on the site and their faces disfigured to make identification impossible.<ref name="Ailsby"/><ref name="WirtzGordon"/><ref>[[Thomas Laqueur]], [http://www.lrb.co.uk/v37/n18/thomas-laqueur/devoted-to-terror 'Devoted to Terror,'] in [[London Review of Books]], Vol. 37 No. 18–24 September 2015, pp. 9–16.</ref> The Germans referred to them by the code phrase "''Konserve''" (canned goods). Some sources incorrectly refer to the incident as Operation Canned Goods.<ref name="Lightbody"/> In an oral testimony at the trials, [[Erwin von Lahousen]] stated that his division of the ''[[Abwehr]]'' was one of two that were given the task of providing [[Polish Army]] uniforms, equipment and identification cards; he was later told by [[Wilhelm Canaris]] that people from concentration camps had been disguised in these uniforms and ordered to attack the radio stations.<ref name="Lahousen">{{cite web|url=http://avalon.law.yale.edu/imt/11-30-45.asp|title=20 Nuremberg Trial Proceedings Volume 2; Friday, 30 November 1945|accessdate=8 November 2012|publisher=[[Avalon Project]]}}</ref>
==Context== [[File:Glivice plaque.JPG|thumb|left|Plaque on site commemorating the incident]]The Gleiwitz incident was a part of a larger operation carried out by [[Abwehr]] and SS forces.<ref name="WirtzGordon"/> Other orchestrated incidents were conducted along the Polish-German border at the same time as the Gleiwitz attack, such as a house burning in the [[Polish Corridor]] and spurious propaganda. The project was called [[Operation Himmler]] and comprised incidents giving the appearance of Polish aggression against Germany.<ref name="Hitler"/><ref name="Lightbody"/> German newspapers and politicians, including [[Adolf Hitler]], had made accusations against Polish authorities for months before the 1939 invasion of organising or tolerating violent [[ethnic cleansing]] of [[Volksdeutsche|ethnic Germans]] living in Poland.<ref name="Hitler"/><ref name="German Editor"/> On 1 September 1939, the day following the Gleiwitz attack, Germany launched ''[[Fall Weiss (1939)|Fall Weiss]]'' (Case White) the invasion of Poland, which precipitated [[European theatre of World War II|World War II]] in Europe. Hitler cited the border incidents in a speech in the [[Reichstag (Weimar Republic)|Reichstag]] on the same day, with three of them called very serious, as justification for his invasion of Poland.<ref name="Hitler"/> Hitler had told his generals on 22 August, "I will provide a propagandistic [[casus belli]]. Its credibility doesn't matter. The victor will not be asked whether he told the truth".<ref name="WirtzGordon"/><ref name="Lightbody"/>
==International reactions== [[United States|American]] correspondents were summoned to the scene the next day but no neutral parties were allowed to investigate the incident in detail and the international public was sceptical of the German version of the incident.<ref name="WirtzGordon"/><ref name="Zaloga"/>
==In popular culture== There have been several adaptations of the incident in cinema. ''[[The Gleiwitz Case|Der Fall Gleiwitz]]'' (1961), directed by Gerhard Klein for [[DEFA (film studio)|DEFA]] studios (''The Gleiwitz Case''; English subtitles), is an [[East Germany|East German]] film that reconstructs the events.<ref name="imdb"/>
''[[Operacja Himmler (film)|Operacja Himmler]]'' (1979) is a Polish film that covers the events.<ref name="imdb1"/>
Both ''[[The Tin Drum (film)|Die Blechtrommel]]'' (1979), directed by [[Volker Schlöndorff]] and ''[[Hitler's SS: Portrait in Evil]]'' (1985), directed by [[Jim Goddard]], briefly include the incident.<ref name="imdb3"/><ref name="imdb2"/>
It was also mentioned in a video game; ''[[Codename: Panzers]]'' (2004), which stirred up controversy in Poland where the game was briefly discussed in Polish media as [[Anti-Polish sentiment|anti-Polish]] falsification of history, before the issue was cleared up as a case of poor reporting.<ref name="gazeta"/>
==See also== * [[Jablunkov Incident]] * [[Mukden Incident]], a similar [[false flag operation]] that started the [[Japanese invasion of Manchuria]] * [[1939 in Poland]] * [[1939 Tarnow rail station bomb attack]] * [[Operation Greif]] * [[Shelling of Mainila]]

Zaloga]], ''Poland 1939: The Birth of Blitzkrieg'', [https://books.google.com/books?id=oQeAKAjlEwMC&pg=PA39&ots=p_29yUfOTD&dq=%22Operation%2BHimmler%22&as_brr=3&sig=ztSquH7JvUE-9t4p3ndbIO-dkOo Google Print, p. 39], Osprey Publishing, 2002; {{ISBN|1-84176-408-6}}</ref>}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2018}} {{Use Australian English|date=May 2018}} The '''Gold Coast Film Festival''' is an annual [[film festival]] held across the [[Gold Coast, Queensland|Gold Coast]] in [[Queensland]], Australia. The festival is a celebration of film culture<ref>medina, s. (2013). Interview With Kylie Pascoe - Gold Coast Film Festival Director | The Otaku's Study. [online] The Otaku's Study. Available at: http://www.otakustudy.com/article/2013/11/interview-kylie-pascoe-gold-coast-film-festival-director/ [Accessed 21 Jun. 2014].</ref> that delivers a program of feature films, special events, seminars and workshops, special guests and art. The Gold Coast Film Festival’s purpose is to emerge the dynamic and creative culture community<ref name="abc.net.au2">Abc.net.au, (2014). The Gold Coast Gears Up For The Gold Coast Film Festival - ABC Melbourne - Australian Broadcasting Corporation. [online] Available at: http://www.abc.net.au/local/stories/2014/03/06/3958253.htm [Accessed 21 Jun. 2014].</ref> and to encourage the next generation of homegrown filmmakers.<ref name="mantra.com.au2">Mantra.com.au, (2014). Cinema buffs unite at the Gold Coast Film Festival - Mantra. [online] Available at: http://www.mantra.com.au/blog/TabId/29275/PostId/334/cinema-buffs-unite-at-the-gold-coast-film-festival.aspx#.U5_dD42SwY8 [Accessed 21 Jun. 2014].</ref> The Gold Coast Film Festival celebrates and promotes all aspects of [[film]] and [[filmmaking]] from one of [[Australia]]’s pre-eminent filmmaking locations and holiday destinations – the [[Gold Coast, Queensland|Gold Coast]]. The festival offers a culturally diverse program of films such as genre films, internationally acclaimed dramas, Japanese anime, local independent films and national and international special guests within the film industry.<ref name="abc.net.au2" />
The Gold Coast Film Festival is the city’s flagship film event and enhances the reputation of the city as one of [[Australia]]’s major filmmaking hubs.
Festival Director Lucy Fisher leads the GCFF, [[Academy Awards|Academy Award]] winner [[John Cox (special effects artist)|John Cox]] holds the position of festival patron, and our board consists of notable industry figures including Mike Selwyn (ex Managing Director – [[Paramount Pictures]]) and [[Film producer|producer]] Chris Brown (''[[The Railway Man (film)|The Railway Man]], [[Daybreakers]]'').
The GCFF is supported by the [[Government of Queensland|QLD State Government]] through [http://screenqueensland.com.au/ Screen QLD] and [http://teq.queensland.com/ Tourism and Events QLD], and the [http://www.goldcoast.qld.gov.au/default.html City of Gold Coast].
==Background== The Gold Coast has had over two decades of international film production with the world-renowned [[Warner Brothers Studios]], the Gold Coast is a profound location for film and television production from its natural endearments, climate, beaches, marine life, rainforest and hinterland that made it an ideal location for film and television production.<ref>Goldsmith, B., Ward, S. and O'Regan, T. (2010). Local Hollywood. 1st ed. St Lucia, Qld.: University of Queensland Press.</ref> The Gold Coast Film Festival has become a major event for the Australian Film Industry and ambitious filmmakers alike worldwide.<ref>Medina, S. (2013). Interview With Kylie Pascoe - Gold Coast Film Festival Director | The Otaku's Study. [online] The Otaku's Study. Available at: http://www.otakustudy.com/article/2013/11/interview-kylie-pascoe-gold-coast-film-festival-director/ [Accessed 21 Jun. 2014].</ref>
Modelled on the [[Brussels International Festival of Fantasy Film]], The Gold Coast Film Festival once showcased the many genres of [[fantasy film]], including [[Science fiction film|science fiction]], [[Horror film|horror]], [[special effect]]s, [[animation]], [[anime]] and children’s fantasy together with sidebar events. The Festival now highlights films from all genres, including horror, fantasy, drama, comedy, independent and documentaries. The festival is open to the public.
The Gold Coast Film Festival also supported Australia's first online video maker award ceremony, the [[Australian Webstream Awards]] in 2013 and is supported by [[ABC Gold Coast]].<ref name="abc.net.au2" /> Past Program Director, Mitch Ziems, helped open the ceremony that took place at the [[Metro Arts Theatre]] in [[Brisbane]], [[Queensland]] on 16 November.<ref name="awa12">{{cite web|url=http://www.webstreamawards.org|title=History, Our Vision, Our Mission|date=8 July 2013|publisher=Webstreamawards.org|author=Australian Webstream Awards|accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref>
Originally Queensland-only, the fest has opened up, looking outside the state for films in a bid "to have that element of discovery rather than just being reliant on distribution to find our films," Festival Director Lucy Fisher says.
The first Gold Coast Film Festival took place in August 2002, the festival director was [[Casey Marshall Siemer]]<ref>http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/coast-rolls-out-action-for-film-festival/story-fn6b3v4f-1226169861960</ref> with Oscar-winning visual effects specialist [[John Cox (special effects artist)|John Cox]] as patron.<ref name="ABC12">{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/newsitems/200208/s638197.htm|title=Australia attracting more fantasy films|date=2 August 2002|publisher=[[Australian Broadcasting Corporation|ABC News Online]]|accessdate=2009-09-20}}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> As of 2014 the Festival Director is now [[Kylie Pascoe]].<ref>Gcfilmfestival.com, (2014). Gold Coast Film Festival. [online] Available at: {{cite web |url=http://www.gcfilmfestival.com/page/2/Media-Centre |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-06-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714042611/http://www.gcfilmfestival.com/page/2/Media-Centre |archivedate=2014-07-14 |df= }} [Accessed 21 Jun. 2014].</ref> The Gold Coast Film festival has a cultural partnership with [[Supanova Pop Culture Expo]] and QPOW! as a part of the Gold Coast’s pop culture heritage<ref>Tooma, C. (2014). Gold Coast Film Festival 2014 program unveiled | myGC.com.au. [online] Mygc.com.au. Available at: http://www.mygc.com.au/news/gold-coast-film-festival-2014-program-unveiled/ [Accessed 21 Jun. 2014].</ref> The Festival is Supported by the [[QLD State Government]] through screen Queensland’s Screen Culture Fund, the tourism and events Queensland Regional Development program and [[The City of the Gold Coast]].<ref>Eventfinder, (2014). The Gold Coast Film Festival. [online] Available at: http://www.eventfinder.com.au/2014/the-gold-coast-film-festival/gold-coast [Accessed 21 Jun. 2014].</ref> The festival also has a series of free filmmaking workshops and seminars<ref>Broadbeachtourism.com.au, (2014). Gold Coast Film Festival. [online] Available at: http://www.broadbeachtourism.com.au/events/gold-coast-film-festival-queensland [Accessed 21 Jun. 2014].</ref> as well as the GCFF Future Filmmakers seminar held at [[Bond University]] for year 11 and 12 high school students who are interested in the film industry to learn from industry leaders, such as directing, writing and producing.<ref name="islandbeach.com.au2">Islandbeach.com.au, (2014). Gold Coast Film Festival - Island Beach Resort Blog. [online] Available at: http://www.islandbeach.com.au/blog/gold-coast-film-festival/54 {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140412113955/http://www.islandbeach.com.au/blog/gold-coast-film-festival/54 |date=12 April 2014 }} [Accessed 21 Jun. 2014].</ref> The festival also has one-hour seminars, workshops and panels called the inaugural REELLIFE program<ref>Gcfilmfestival.com, (2014). Gold Coast Film Festival. [online] Available at: {{cite web |url=http://gcfilmfestival.com/news/77/Gold_Coast_Film_Festival_Focuses_on_Industry_with_REELLIFE |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-06-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150316085716/http://gcfilmfestival.com/news/77/Gold_Coast_Film_Festival_Focuses_on_Industry_with_REELLIFE |archivedate=2015-03-16 |df= }} [Accessed 21 Jun. 2014].</ref> tailored for the aspiring filmmaker on topics such as financing, film distribution and building online content, which are also presented by industry leaders.<ref name="islandbeach.com.au2" />
== 2017 Gold Coast Film Festival == The 15th annual Gold Coast Film Festival will run from Wednesday 19 April – Sunday 30 April 2017 at venues across the [[Gold Coast, Queensland|Gold Coast]].
The full 2017 Program of films and events will be announced in early March. You can expect everything from Australian indie gems to European drama and intriguing American arthouse. There will also be Q&A’s with filmmakers, film industry panels and schools screenings and talks.
For the first time in its 15-year history, the Gold Coast Film Festival 2017 will accept submissions for feature films to screen at the event.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.goldcoastbulletin.com.au/entertainment/shorts-in-paradise-film-festival-aka-sipfest-set-for-gold-coast/news-story/b45cde543b394494caeef334e51427d2|title=Short film fest set to be reel deal|access-date=2017-01-24}}</ref>
==2016 Gold Coast Film Festival== The 2016 Gold Coast Film Festival attracted a record 14,148 attendees across ten days of film screenings and events, increasing attendance by 12% on the previous year.
From internationally acclaimed [[Drama film genre|dramas]], [[Comedy film|comedies]] and genre films, locally made [[Indie film|indie]] gems and family features, the GCFF offered a culturally diverse, interactive and engaging program of film, events and special guests.
The Festival welcomed some impressive International and Australian industry guests, including [[Claudia Karvan]], [[Gracie Otto]] and [[David Stratton]].
For filmmakers and students alike the festival runs a series of free seminars and workshops to educate, inspire and embrace the Gold Coast as a filmmaking destination.
Our location is one with a heritage of filmmaking, with international filmmaking introduced on the Gold Coast in the late 1980s. Fast-forward to 2017 and major international films ''[[Unbroken (film)|Unbroken]]'', ''[[Pirates of the Caribbean (film series)|Pirates of the Caribbean]] and [[Thor: Ragnarok|Thor: Rangarok]]'' have chosen the Gold Coast’s incredible locations and highly competent crew to shoot their multimillion-dollar films.
== Gold Coast Film Industry == The [[Gold Coast, Queensland|Gold Coast]] boasts a heritage of [[filmmaking]], with international filmmaking introduced to the city in the late 1980s.
Fast-forward to 2017 and in the past year, major international films ''[[Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales]] and [[Thor: Ragnarok|Thor: Rangarok]]'' have chosen the Gold Coast’s incredible locations and highly competent crew to shoot their multimillion-dollar films.
US productions that have chosen to shoot on the Gold Coast have a combined production budget of A$1.7 billion alone.
As the city’s flagship film event we aim to enhance the reputation of the city as one of Australia’s major filmmaking hubs.
[[Village Roadshow Studios]] is a big drawcard in attracting international production to the city. The studios offer film production facilities consisting of eight [[sound stage]]s, three water tanks, ten production offices, editing suites, wardrobe, makeup, construction, paint and carpentry shops.
Equally, the incredibly diverse range of [[Filming location|film locations]] on the [[Gold Coast, Queensland|Gold Coast]] means everything from swamps to city scenes, waterfalls to beaches can be shot here.
Local production is also healthy, with a steady stream of productions shooting on the Gold Coast, including in the past year, [[Jungle (2017 film)|Jungle]] and Flammable Children.
Recent productions filmed or edited on the Gold Coast include: * [[Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales|Pirated Of The Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales]] * [[Thor: Ragnarok]] * [[Kong: Skull Island]] * [[The Shallows (film)|The Shallows]] * [[Unbroken (film)|Unbroken]] * Nest * Jungle * [[The Age of Adaline|The Age Of Adaline]] * [[San Andreas (film)|San Andreas]] * [[The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader|The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Trader]]
==See also== {{Portal|Gold Coast|Queensland}} *[[List of festivals in Australia]]

{{italic title}} '''''Imagining Madoff''''' is a 2010 play by playwright [[Deb Margolin]] that tells the story of an imagined encounter between [[Bernard Madoff]], the admitted operator of what has been described as the largest [[Ponzi scheme]] in history, and his victims. Margolin had originally planned to use Nobel Laureate and Holocaust survivor [[Elie Wiesel]] as a character representing a victim, but was obliged by legal threats to substitute a fictional character, whom she named Solomon Galkin.
==Elie Wiesel's response to the play== Wiesel had been one of Madoff's most notable victims, having lost his life savings to Madoff's fraud in addition to more than $15 million in losses to a charitable foundation Wiesel operated, the Elie Wiesel Foundation for Humanity, with Wiesel calling Madoff a "thief, scoundrel, criminal".<ref>Strom, Stephanie. [https://www.nytimes.com/2009/02/27/business/27madoff.html "Elie Wiesel Levels Scorn at Madoff"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', February 26, 2009. Accessed July 19, 2010.</ref> Wiesel had been chosen as a character by Margolin because she felt that he was "synonymous with decency, morality, the struggle for human dignity and kindness".<ref>Horwitz, Jane. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/05/18/AR2010051804934.html "Theater J pulls Madoff play after objections from activist Elie Wiesel"], ''[[The Washington Post]]'', May 19, 2010. Accessed July 20, 2010.</ref> In Margolin's original version of the play, the Elie Wiesel character was intended to be a [[moral authority]] and key character in the play, in which he recounted his [[concentration camp]] experiences and provided meditations on repentance. Margolin sent a copy of the play to Wiesel, who responded in April 2010 with a letter calling the play "obscene" and "defamatory" and threatening legal action to prevent the play from being staged.<ref name=NYT20100719>Healy, Patrick. [https://www.nytimes.com/2010/07/20/theater/20madoff.html "The Play on Madoff, Without Wiesel"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', July 19, 2010. Accessed July 19, 2010.</ref> In an interview with [[National Public Radio]] on May 20, 2010, attorney Richard Lehv expressed his opinion that Wiesel would have had little chance in court of preventing Margolin from using him as a character, noting that "it's a free country. You can make a public figure a character in a work of fiction."<ref>[https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127018737 When Truth Meets Fiction, Lawyers Intervene], [[National Public Radio]], May 20, 2010. Accessed July 19, 2010.</ref>
==Productions== The play was originally to have been staged at [[Theater J]], a Jewish theater in [[Washington, D.C.]] in May 2010, but was canceled after Wiesel made his objections known.<ref name=NYT20100519>Taylor, Kate. [http://artsbeat.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/05/19/play-canceled-after-wiesel-objects/ "Play Canceled After Wiesel Objects"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', May 19, 2010. Accessed July 19, 2010.</ref> After [[Ari Roth]], artistic director of Theater J, had offered to submit the play to Wiesel's foundation for review, Margolin objected, viewing the offer as giving Wiesel veto power over the play's content.<ref>Fischer, Jonathan L. [http://www.washingtoncitypaper.com/blogs/artsdesk/theater/2010/07/19/imagining-madoff-sans-elie-wiesel-opens-this-week-new-york/ "''Imagining Madoff'', sans Elie Wiesel, Opens This Week in New York"], ''[[Washington City Paper]]'', July 19, 2010. Accessed July 19, 2010.</ref> Margolin called the experience "painful" and said that she was "still scared to talk about it" because of fear of lawsuits, but she felt that she "didn't want to abandon this play".<ref name=NYT20100719/> Though the character of Wiesel was formally excised from the play, the replacement character Solomon Galkin, described in the play's script as "80 years old, Holocaust survivor, poet, translator, treasurer of his synagogue", retained most of the dialogue that had originally been planned for the Wiesel character.<ref name=NYT20100719/>
The revised play premiered in July-August 2010 at Stageworks/Hudson in [[Hudson, New York]].<ref>Review, ''Times Union'', July 25, 2010. Accessed on 7/7/11 at: http://blog.timesunion.com/reviews/imagining-madoff-stageworkshudson-72510/2765/ </ref> It ran at Washington's Theater J from August 31 to September 25, 2011.<ref>Theater J website, accessed on 7/7/11 at: http://washingtondcjcc.org/center-for-arts/theater-j/on-stage/11-12-season/ </ref>
Artistic director Laura Margolis of Stageworks/Hudson has commented that nothing was lost by removing the Wiesel character, and that the new version of the play gave Margolin greater liberties to develop the Galkin character as a person, rather than as representing a famous figure. In a July 2010 article in ''[[The New York Times]]'', Margolin emphasized that she had never planned "to be on the wrong side of anybody, let alone someone I admire".<ref name=NYT20100719/>
The [[New Repertory Theatre]] of Watertown, MA staged the New England premiere in January 2014, which included sixteen sold-out performances. An encore extension was co-presented with the Boston Center for American Performance at the Boston University Theatre-Comley Studio 210 in May-June 2014.
==Awards== On February 27, 2012, Deb Margolin's '''''Imagining Madoff''''' was nominated for the 28th Annual [[Helen Hayes Awards]] which celebrates excellence in professional theater in the Washington D.C. area.<ref>Playbill.com, accessed on 2/29/12 at: http://www.playbill.com/news/article/160175-DCs-Helen-Hayes-Nominees-Include-Hairspray-Eric-Schaeffer-Jan-Maxwell-Imagining-Madoff </ref>

{{EngvarB|date=February 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2015}}
The shooting down of [[Malaysia Airlines Flight 17]] on 17 July 2014 provoked reactions from many countries and organisations.
==Countries== {{flagu|Argentina}}{{spaced ndash}} Argentinian President [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner|Cristina Fernández]] expressed her deep condolence to the families of the victims and called for an independent and fair investigation of the tragedy.<ref name="sputnik">{{cite web|url=http://sputniknews.com/world/20140719/191033129.html|title=China, Argentina Call For Independent Investigation of Plane Crash in Ukraine|publisher=[[Sputnik (news agency)|Sputnik]]|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
[[File:20th International AIDS Conference (Melbourne, Australia) - Makeshift Memorial for the Victims of MH17.JPG|thumb|Makeshift memorial at the [[International AIDS Conference]] in Melbourne. Six delegates died in the shootdown.]] {{flagu|Australia}}{{spaced ndash}} In an address to the parliament, Australian Prime Minister [[Tony Abbott]] said that the aircraft was downed by a missile which seems to have been launched by Russian-backed rebels.<ref name=DT>{{cite news|last1=Maiden|first1=Samantha|title=MH17: Russia says Tony Abbott 'operating only on speculation' in his tough stance over separatist involvement in plane tragedy|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/nsw/mh17-russia-says-tony-abbott-operating-only-on-speculation-in-his-tough-stance-over-separatist-involvement-in-plane-tragedy/story-fni0cx12-1226994356506?nk=5ad2afc7bd4e4530771c2b41016dee48|accessdate=19 July 2014|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=Australia|date=19 July 2014}}</ref> Moreover, [[Julie Bishop]], the Australian Minister for Foreign Affairs said in an interview on an Australian television programme that it was "extraordinary" that her Russian counterparts have refused to speak to her over the shoot-down after the Russian ambassador was summoned to meet her.<ref name=DT /> The Russian government was critical of Abbott's response, branding his comments as "inappropriate" and an "accusation of guilt based on speculation", as Abbott was one of the first world leaders to publicly connect the shoot-down to Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-07-19/russia-says-abbott-comments-mh17-downing-unacceptable/5608852?pfm=ms |title=Malaysia Airlines MH17: Russia says Tony Abbott's comments blaming separatists are 'unacceptable', Julie Bishop criticises Moscow for lack of talks |publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corporation |accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref> Abbott later criticised the recovery efforts as "shambolic", and "more like a garden clean-up than a forensic investigation", while Bishop publicly warned separatist forces against treating the victims' bodies as hostages.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-07-21/government-considers-declaring-mh17-disaster-a-terrorist-act/5610908?pfm=ms |title=MH17: Prime Minister Tony Abbott hits out at 'shambolic' recovery effort; Government considers listing outrage as terrorist act; rebels move bodies to refrigerated train |publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corporation |date=17 July 2014 |accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref>
The downing of the flight had resulted in the death of 38 Australian citizens and residents. In the lead up to the 2014 G20 meeting in Brisbane, Tony Abbott sought to focus attention on Russia's role in the shooting. In a meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin at the APEC meeting in Beijing, Abbott reportedly told the president that Australia had information that the missile that destroyed the plane had Russian origin and that Russia should consider apologising and offering appropriate restitution to the victims of the shooting. Russia continued to deny involvement.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/nov/12/tony-abbott-vladimir-putin-consider-apology-compensation-mh17 Tony Abbott tells Vladimir Putin to consider apology and compensation for MH17]; The Guardian; 12 November</ref>
Australian Prime Minister [[Malcolm Turnbull]] stated that, after the release of the Dutch Safety Board report into the shoot-down, Australia "will not be bullied by Russia" and that "those who committed this crime must answer for it". Turnbull also stated in regards to the Russian veto at the UN Security Council that "we [Australia] deplore the conduct of Russia using its Security Council veto in July to block the establishment of a special international criminal tribunal".<ref>{{Cite web|title = Prime Minister vows Australia will seek justice for MH17 victims|url = http://www.abc.net.au/news/2015-10-14/turnbull-vows-australia-will-seek-justice-for-mh17-victims/6853982|website = ABC News|accessdate = 2015-10-14|language = en}}</ref>
{{flagu|Austria}}{{spaced ndash}} Austrian [[Federal Ministry for Europe, Integration and Foreign Affairs|Foreign Affairs Minister]] [[Sebastian Kurz]] called for a full investigation of the cause of the tragedy and a "free access for the experts".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ots.at/presseaussendung/OTS_20140720_OTS0002/kurz-in-oesterreich-ueber-mh-17-absturz-moeglich-dass-sich-putin-distanziert|title=Kurz in ÖSTERREICH über MH 17-Absturz: "Möglich, dass sich Putin distanziert".|language=German|publisher=Österreich|date=20 July 2014|accessdate=20 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Bahrain}}{{spaced ndash}} The Crown Prince of Bahrain [[Salman bin Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa|Salman bin Hamad Al-Khalifa]] expressed his sincere condolences following the tragic crash of the aircraft, on behalf of His Majesty [[Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa|King Hamad]] and the Kingdom of Bahrain, to the [[Yang di-Pertuan Agong|King]], government and people of Malaysia during a telephone conversation with the Malaysian Prime Minister. HRH Crown Prince asked God Almighty to protect Malaysia and other Muslim countries from such tragedies. He expressed his deepest sympathy for the families of the victims, praying for their souls to rest in peace and for their families to find courage and strength.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bna.bh/portal/en/news/626687|title=HRH Crown Prince offers condolences to Malaysian Prime Minister|author=MJ|agency=Bahrain News Agency|date=20 July 2014|accessdate=31 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Bangladesh}}{{spaced ndash}} Bangladeshi Prime Minister [[Sheikh Hasina]] expressed her deep shock over the crash of Malaysian passenger airliner. In her message of condolence to Malaysian Prime Minister on behalf of the government and the people of Bangladesh, "We pray that Almighty [[Allah]] may grant eternal peace to the departed souls and courage and fortitude to the families of the victims to bear the loss". [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Bangladesh)|Bangladeshi Foreign Minister]] AH Mahmood Ali sent a separate message to the Malaysian foreign minister. He also expressed his shock and conveyed his deep condolence and heartfelt sympathy to the members of the bereaved families.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailystar.net/pm-shocked-at-malaysian-plane-crash-33956|title=PM shocked at Malaysian plane crash|work=[[The Daily Star (Bangladesh)|The Daily Star]]|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=30 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Belarus}}{{spaced ndash}} Belarusian President [[Alexander Lukashenko]] sent condolences to the head of state of Malaysia, the King of the Netherlands and the Governor-General of the Commonwealth of Australia over the victims of the Malaysia Airlines plane crash. In a statement, he said "On behalf of the Belarusian people I extend sincere condolences in connection with the terrible crash of the Malaysia Airlines Boeing 777 in the Ukrainian airspace".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://president.gov.by/en/news_en/view/alexander-lukashenko-extends-condolences-over-malaysian-plane-crash-in-ukraine-9268/|title=Alexander Lukashenko extends condolences over Malaysian plane crash in Ukraine|publisher=[[President of Belarus]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Belgium}}{{spaced ndash}} Belgian Prime Minister [[Elio Di Rupo]] said "On behalf of the [[Government of Belgium|Belgian government]], he expressed his sincere condolences to the families and friends of the many victims of the flight of Malaysia Airlines. His thoughts are paying particular to the five Belgian victims, their families and friends. He also expressed deep sympathy with the Dutch people and the Dutch authorities. Di Rupo said he wanted "full clarity comes over the exact circumstances of this tragedy and that those responsible are quickly identified and brought to justice".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rtlnieuws.nl/nieuws/buitenland/di-rupo-leeft-mee-met-nabestaanden-vlucht-mh17|title=Di Rupo leeft mee met nabestaanden vlucht MH17|language=Dutch|publisher=Rtlnieuws|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Brazil}}{{spaced ndash}} Brazilian President [[Dilma Rousseff]] said in a statement that "the [[Government of Brazil|Brazilian government]] will be in the neutral position until there is clearer information about the incident".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/internacional/noticia/2014-07/dilma-diz-que-e-preciso-ter-prudencia-ao-avaliar-queda-de-aviao-na|title=Di Rupo leeft mee met nabestaanden vlucht MH17|author1=Danilo Macedo|author2=Luana Lourenço|language=Portuguese|publisher=[[Agência Brasil]]|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> She stressed that it is necessary to find those responsible for the shot down.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.correiobraziliense.com.br/app/noticia/mundo/2014/07/17/interna_mundo,437963/presidente-dilma-pede-prudencia-na-responsabilizacao-do-caso-do-voo-mh17.shtml|title=Presidente Dilma pede prudência na responsabilização do caso do voo MH17|author=Correio Braziliense|language=Portuguese|publisher=[[Correio Braziliense]]|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Brunei}}{{spaced ndash}} His Majesty the [[List of Sultans of Brunei|Sultan of Brunei]] [[Hassanal Bolkiah]] has sent condolence messages to Malaysian and Dutch leaders following the crash of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 in Ukraine. In his messages, the monarch said he was deeply saddened to hear of the shocking news. His Majesty further said Her Majesty [[Pengiran Anak Saleha]], the government and people of Brunei joined him in expressing their condolences and sympathies to the victims' families. The Sultan also prayed that "Allah S.W.T would bestow His blessings upon the victims' souls and place them among his loved and pious ones".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bt.com.bn/bookmarks-breaking/2014/07/18/just-hm-extends-condolences-malaysian-dutch-leaders-over-mh17-crash|title=JUST IN: HM extends condolences to Malaysian, Dutch leaders over MH17 crash|work=[[The Brunei Times]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=26 July 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140726055352/http://bt.com.bn/bookmarks-breaking/2014/07/18/just-hm-extends-condolences-malaysian-dutch-leaders-over-mh17-crash|archivedate=26 July 2014|deadurl=no}}</ref>
{{flagu|Bulgaria}}{{spaced ndash}} Bulgarian President [[Rosen Plevneliev]] sent his condolences to the King of the Netherlands and Malaysia on behalf of the Bulgarian people for the families and relatives of the victims. The president strongly condemns any act of violence, which leads to loss of life and calls for the immediate and full international investigation to establish the causes and those responsible for what happened.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://btvnovinite.bg/article/bulgaria/rosen-plevneliev-dalboko-sam-opechalen-ot-tragediyata.html|title=Росен Плевнелиев: Дълбоко съм опечален от трагедията|language=Bulgarian|publisher=[[bTV (Bulgaria)|bTV]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Canada}}{{spaced ndash}} Canadian Prime Minister [[Stephen Harper]] issued a statement saying that he was "shocked and saddened" to have learned of the downing of the flight. He also stated that while it was not clear what caused the crash, the Government of Canada continued "to condemn Russia’s military aggression and illegal occupation of Ukraine, which is at the root of the ongoing conflict in the region."<ref>{{cite web|title=Statement of the Prime Minister of Canada on the Downing of a Malaysia Airlines Flight|url=http://pm.gc.ca/eng/news/2014/07/17/statement-prime-minister-canada-downing-malaysia-airlines-flight|website=Office of the Prime Minister|publisher=Government of Canada|accessdate=20 July 2014}}</ref> Foreign Affairs Minister [[John Baird (Canadian politician)|John Baird]] has called for a "credible and unimpeded" international investigation into the crash and called for pro-Russian forces to withdraw from the crash site.<ref>{{cite news|last1=The Canadian Press|title=MH17: Baird calls for credible probe into Ukraine plane crash|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/politics/mh17-baird-calls-for-credible-probe-into-crash/article19683259/|accessdate=20 July 2014|work=The Globe and Mail|date=19 July 2014}}</ref> Baird also levelled blame for the accident on Russia and the rebels saying "The Kremlin may not have pulled the trigger, but it certainly loaded the gun and put it in the murderer’s hand".<ref>{{cite news|last1=The Associated Press |title= MH17: Canada to strengthen sanctions on Russia |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/malaysia-airlines-flight-mh17-canada-to-strengthen-sanctions-on-russia-1.2713132 |accessdate=29 July 2014|publisher=[[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation]] |date=21 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Chile}}{{spaced ndash}} Chilean government gives its heartfelt condolences to the families of the victims and asked that an investigation need to be conducted with "extensive, rigorous and transparent facts". The perpetrators also should not may go unpunished and any other accomplices must be brought to justice.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.minrel.gov.cl/gobierno-de-chile-expresa-condolencias-y-solicita-una-investigacion-amplia-rigurosa-y-transparente-por-tragedia-del-vuelo-mh17-de-malaysian-airlines/minrel/2014-07-18/145230.html|title=Gobierno de Chile expresa condolencias y solicita una investigación amplia, rigurosa y transparente por tragedia del vuelo MH17 de Malaysian Airlines|language=Spanish|publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Chile)]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref><ref name="latinoamerica">{{cite web|url=http://hispantv.com/detail.aspx?id=280898|title=Latinoamérica lamenta tragedia de avión malasio|language=Spanish|publisher=[[HispanTV]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lanacion.cl/noticias/pais/rree/chile-pide-pesquisa-transparente-sobre-derribo-de-avion-de-malaysia-airlines/2014-07-18/165152.html|title=Chile Pide Pesquisa "Transparente" Sobre Derribo de Avión de Malaysia Airlines|language=Spanish|author=María E. Durán|work=La Nacion|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|China}}{{spaced ndash}} Chinese President [[Xi Jinping]] sent condolences to the Malaysian and Dutch King over the loss of lives in the downed aircraft, adding that he urged for an independent and fair investigation of the tragedy.<ref name="sputnik"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/china/2014-07/19/c_133496224.htm|title=Chinese president sends messages of condolence to Malaysian, Dutch leaders over MH17 disaster|author=An|publisher=English.news.cn|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=31 July 2014}}</ref> While Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Qin Gang also offered his deep condolence to all victims.<ref>{{cite web|title=China sends condolences to victims' families in MH17 crash|url=http://english.cntv.cn/2014/07/18/VIDE1405638726974401.shtml|publisher=China Central Television|accessdate=27 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Colombia}}{{spaced ndash}} Colombian President [[Juan Manuel Santos]] issued a statement saying that he gave out instructions to the embassy for the United Nations to "back-up any actions leading to establishing the truth and those responsible of this atrocious crime in Ukraine".<ref>{{cite web|title=Colombia demanded for actions to clarify downing of plane in Ukraine|url=http://www.eltiempo.com/mundo/europa/santos-se-pronuncio-sobre-derribo-de-avion-en-ucrania/14269661|publisher=ElTiempo.com|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> Colombia's [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Colombia)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] issued a press release expressing its condolences to the friends and families of the 298 victims that left the downing of the Malaysia Airlines aircraft. The press release ended with the Ministry claiming that "We (Colombia) join with the international community to demand that the involved parties in Ukraine allow a transparent, credible, and urgent investigation in the shortest time possible".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cancilleria.gov.co/newsroom/publiques/2014-07-18/9633|title=Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores expresa condolencias a familiares y amigos del avión de Malaysia Airlines|language=Spanish|publisher=Cancilleria|place=Colombia|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Costa Rica}}{{spaced ndash}} Costa Rica through its foreign ministry condemn the brutal attack on a commercial flight that was carrying civilians, which constitutes a crime against humanity.<ref name="latinoamerica"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://lainfo.es/pt/2014/07/18/costa-rica-condena-ataque-brutal-em-voo-de-malaysia-airlines/|title=Costa Rica condena 'ataque brutal' em vôo de Malaysia Airlines|language=Spanish|publisher=lainfo.es|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Cuba}}{{spaced ndash}} Cuban former President [[Fidel Castro]] blames the government of Ukraine for the downing of the Malaysian aeroplane.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://noticias.lainformacion.com/mundo/fidel-castro-responsabiliza-al-proimperialista-gobierno-ucraniano-de-la-caida-del-avion_nJInmmByYV8Db0EWoszPS4/|title=Fidel Castro responsabiliza al 'proimperialista' Gobierno ucraniano de la caída del avión|language=Spanish|publisher=lainformacion.com|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Cyprus}}{{spaced ndash}} Cypriot President [[Nicos Anastasiades]] signed the book of condolences at the Dutch Embassy in [[Nicosia]] and expressed sympathy to the government and people of the Netherlands.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://famagusta-gazette.com/president-signs-book-of-condolences-for-flight-mh-p24421-69.htm|title=President signs book of condolences for flight MH17|publisher=Famagusta Gazette|date=23 July 2014|accessdate=23 July 2014}}</ref> Earlier, the Cypriot [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Cyprus)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] called for an immediate investigation and extend their condolences to the families of the victims onboard by conveying sympathy to the Prime Ministers of the Netherlands and Malaysia as well as to the governments of all other nations of which citizens have senselessly lost their lives in the tragic incident.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mfa.gov.cy/mfa/embassies/hagueembassy.nsf/DMLindex_en/DMLindex_en?OpenDocument|title=Statement of the Minister of Foreign Affairs for the victims of the plane crash in Ukraine|work=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Cyprus)]]|publisher=Embassy of the Republic of Cyprus in The Hague, Netherlands|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Czech Republic}}{{spaced ndash}} [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Czech Republic)|Czech Foreign Minister]] [[Lubomír Zaorálek]] during a meeting at the [[Foreign Affairs Council|Council of the European Union for Foreign Affairs]] expressed his deep condolences to the families of the victims and the governments of the involved countries. He added "Separatists must ensure unrestricted and safe access to the point of impact of the aeroplane, enabling examination of the accident and to ensure humane treatment and repatriation of victims. Those who committed this crime will be held accountable. We demand dignified treatment of the remains of the victims and permanent access to international disaster experts, in order to perform a proper independent investigation".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mzv.cz/jnp/cz/udalosti_a_media/x2014_07_22_ministr_zaoralek_v_bruselu.html|title=Ministr Zaorálek: Viníci tragédie letu MH17 musí být potrestáni|language=Czech|publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Czech Republic)]]|date=22 July 2014|accessdate=22 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Denmark}}{{spaced ndash}} Danish Prime Minister [[Helle Thorning-Schmidt]] called for an "thorough and independent" inquiry into the incident and called the international community to reach an agreement on how to hold the responsible parties accountable. On a statement, she said "We completely support calls for a thorough and independent investigation to be carried out soon into the circumstances that led to this tragic incident and we need the international community to discuss what consequences there should be and how to hold those responsible accountable".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thelocal.dk/20140718/pm-calls-for-thorough-and-independent-inquiry-into-mh17|title=PM calls for 'thorough' inquiry into MH17|publisher=[[The Local]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|East Timor}}{{spaced ndash}} President [[Taur Matan Ruak]] expressed "shocked" over the tragedy and offered condolences to the Malaysian government and in particular, to the bereaved families and the countries of the nationalities involved.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rtp.pt/noticias/mundo/presidente-timorense-chocado-com-circunstancias-da-queda-do-voo-mh17-na-ucrania_n754218|title=Presidente timorense chocado com circunstâncias da queda do voo MH17 na Ucrânia|language=Portuguese|author=Lusa|publisher=[[Rádio e Televisão de Portugal]]|date=21 July 2014|accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Ecuador}}{{spaced ndash}} Ecuador through its Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Human Mobility expressed their "deep regret" over what happened to the flight and expressed "its solidarity with the families of the victims". The Foreign Ministry of Ecuador also strongly condemn the action and support a thorough investigation.<ref name="latinoamerica"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.elciudadano.gob.ec/ecuador-expresa-su-profundo-pesar-y-su-solidaridad-por-las-victimas-del-vuelo-mh017-de-malaysia-airlines/|title=Ecuador expresa su profundo pesar y su solidaridad por las víctimas del vuelo MH017 de Malaysia Airlines|language=Spanish|author=Juan Pablo Ruiz|publisher=elciudadano.gob.ec|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
[[File:2014-07-18 Flowers and candles on the doorstep of Embassy of Netherlands in Estonia.jpg|thumb|Flowers and candles at the Netherlands Embassy in [[Tallinn]], Estonia]] {{flagu|Estonia}}{{spaced ndash}} The Estonian Prime Minister [[Taavi Rõivas]] on his statement, "We are going on to tightening sanctions against Russia. It is our moral obligation to the victims of MH17".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.delfi.ee/news/paevauudised/eesti/valitsus-otsustas-erakorralisel-istungil-toetada-taiendavaid-piiravaid-meetmeid-venemaa-suhtes.d?id=69423699|title=Valitsus otsustas erakorralisel istungil toetada täiendavaid piiravaid meetmeid Venemaa suhtes|author=Risto Veskioja|language=Estonian|publisher=[[Delfi (web portal)|Delfi]]|date=25 July 2014|accessdate=29 July 2014}}</ref> [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Estonia)|Estonian Foreign Minister]] [[Urmas Paet]] said that his country is ready to participate on the MH17 investigation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/xinhua-news-agency/140721/estonia-ready-participate-mh17-investigation|title=Estonia ready to participate in MH17 investigation|agency=[[Xinhua News Agency]]|publisher=[[GlobalPost]]|date=22 July 2014|accessdate=29 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Fiji}}{{spaced ndash}} Fiji's interim Prime Minister [[Frank Bainimarama]] has sent his condolences to Australia over the loss of lives in the Malaysia Airlines crash.<ref>{{cite web|title=Fiji leader Frank Bainimarama sends message of condolence to Australia over MH17 disaster|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-07-20/fiji-pm-bainimaram-sends-condolences-over-australian-deaths-/5610040|publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corporation|accessdate=27 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Finland}}{{spaced ndash}} Finnish President [[Sauli Niinistö]] and Prime Minister [[Alexander Stubb]] have offered their condolences to those affected by the loss of life aboard the flight. Niinistö said he offered his deepest condolences on his own behalf as well as on behalf of the people of Finland to the families and loved ones of the victims. The written message was sent to the Malaysian Prime Minister as well as to the King of the Netherlands. Stubb called for all parties to immediately launch a thorough and independent investigation into the events in eastern Ukraine.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://yle.fi/uutiset/finnish_heads_offer_condolences_on_demise_of_malaysian_airlines_flight/7364988|title=Finnish heads offer condolences on demise of Malaysian Airlines flight|publisher=[[Yle Uutiset]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> Niinistö also had spoken on telephone with Vladimir Putin to ensure that Russia is fully co-operating to probe the shooting down of the flight. He told Putin that the plane's fate must be determined by an impartial, independent international investigation, and that blocking or endangering this would be reprehensible.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://yle.fi/uutiset/russian_and_finnish_presidents_discuss_mh17_ceasefire_hopes/7372538|title=Russian and Finnish presidents discuss MH17, ceasefire hopes|publisher=Yle Uutiset|date=23 July 2014|accessdate=23 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|France}}{{spaced ndash}} French President [[François Hollande]] offered "all of his solidarity" with relatives of the crash victims, and made calls for a wide-ranging investigation to find the cause of the tragedy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thelocal.fr/20140718/malaysia-airlines-flight-17-france-hollande|title=France demands probe into Malaysian jet crash|publisher=The Local|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Georgia}}{{spaced ndash}} The [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Georgia|Georgian Foreign Ministry]] express its deep sadness over the crash and demand an investigation on the causes which led to the tragedy. The Foreign Ministry conveys its sincere condolences to the governments and people of the Netherlands, Malaysia and of all those countries whose citizens were on board the aircraft, and expresses its solidarity with the families of the victims. Adding "At this stage, it can be unequivocally stated that the crash is a disastrous consequence of the armed conflict in Ukraine, which is in breach of national and international law and of the country's sovereignty and territorial integrity".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://cyprus.mfa.gov.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=193&info_id=25478|title=Statement of the Georgian Foreign Ministry in reaction to the crash of a Malaysia Airlines aeroplane over Ukraine|work=Press and Information Department|publisher=Embassy of Georgia to the Republic of Cyprus|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
