{{flagu|Germany}}{{spaced ndash}} German Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] called for an immediate ceasefire in Ukraine to permit a probe into the apparent downing of a passenger plane in the rebel-held east of the country and a swift, independent inquiry.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Maud van Gaal|first1=Elco van Groningen|title=Malaysian Air Flight 17 May Have U.S., French Citizens|publisher=Bloomberg|date=17 July 2014}}</ref> Merkel said Russia in particular must do its part to end the conflict, adding that Moscow bore responsibility.<ref>{{cite web|agency=Agence France-Presse |url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2014-07-18/news/51708717_1_osce-crash-probe-ukraine |title=Angela Merkel urges immediate ceasefire in Ukraine, Malaysia Airlines MH17 crash probe |work=The Economic Times |date=18 July 2014 |accessdate=24 July 2014}}</ref> The Chancellor also had telephoned Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak to express her condolences over the tragedy and said Germany was prepared to assist Malaysia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/special/2014-07/23/c_133505865.htm|title=Merkel phones Malaysian PM to send condolences on MH17 tragedy|author=Yan|publisher=English.news.cn|date=23 July 2014|accessdate=29 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Greece}}{{spaced ndash}} Greek [[Deputy Prime Minister of Greece|Deputy Prime Minister]] and [[Minister for Foreign Affairs (Greece)|Foreign Minister]] [[Evangelos Venizelos]] expressed deep condolences over the air tragedy, saying "the loss of so many lives causes deep sorrow. We express condolences to the families of the victims and we expect an independent international investigation which will fully clarify the causes of the tragedy". In the light of information that the plane was allegedly shot down, the Greek leader repeated a plea "for the peaceful resolution of the crisis in eastern Ukraine to avoid acts which could lead to the increase of tension".<ref name="european">{{cite web|url=http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/871380.shtml|title=European governments express condolences, demand action over MH17 crash|agency=Xinhua News Agency|publisher=[[Global Times]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Guatemala}}{{spaced ndash}} The [[Government of Guatemala]] presents its condolences to the families of the victims and governments of the different nationalities of the dead passengers. The Guatemalan [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Guatemala)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] urged the relevant authorities to investigate.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.agn.com.gt/index.php/world/fashion/item/18152-guatemala-lamenta-cat%C3%A1strofe-a%C3%A9rea-en-ucrania|title=Guatemala lamenta catástrofe aérea en Ucrania|author=Ferdy Montepeque|language=Spanish|publisher=Agencia AGN Guatemalteca de Noticias|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Holy See}}{{spaced ndash}} [[Pope Francis]] has pledged his prayers for the victims of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17. In a statement, the Vatican said the Pontiff had learnt "with dismay" of the tragedy of the aeroplane downed in east Ukraine and said the Pope would pray for the numerous victims of the incident and for their relatives.<ref name="ci">{{cite web|url=http://www.catholicireland.net/pope-francis-prays-victims-mh17/|title=Pope Francis prays for victims of MH17|author=Sarah Mac Donald|publisher=CatholicIreland.net|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Hungary}}{{spaced ndash}} Prime Minister [[Viktor Orbán]] said in a radio interview that the "unusual, rare and shocking" downing of the Malaysian passenger jet over the eastern part of Ukraine requires a thorough investigation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kormany.hu/en/the-prime-minister/news/prime-minister-downing-of-malaysian-airliner-requires-thorough-investigation|title=Prime Minister: Downing of Malaysian airliner requires thorough investigation|publisher=[[Government of Hungary]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> Earlier the Hungarian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Trade said "it is important that an independent international body to investigate the circumstances of the Malaysian airliner tragedy".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kormany.hu/hu/kulgazdasagi-es-kulugyminiszterium/hirek/fuggetlen-nemzetkozi-testulet-vizsgalja-ki-a-korulmenyeket|title=Független nemzetközi testület vizsgálja ki a körülményeket!|language=Hungarian|publisher=Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Trade|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Iceland}}{{spaced ndash}} Icelandic [[Minister for Foreign Affairs (Iceland)|Minister for Foreign Affairs]] [[Gunnar Bragi Sveinsson]] expresses condolences to the families and friends of the people on board of the aeroplane and expresses strong condemnation for the shot down. On his statement, he said "It is horrendous that a passenger plane has been shot down with advanced anti-aircraft weapons". He has urged that an objective international investigation be initiated immediately and stressed that rescue workers must be allowed to do their job properly. The minister also urged the international community to join forces to stop the conflict in Eastern Ukraine.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mfa.is/news-and-publications/nr/8173|title=Statement on events in Ukraine|publisher=[[Minister for Foreign Affairs (Iceland)]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|India}}{{spaced ndash}} Indian President [[Pranab Mukherjee]] deeply condoled the crash of the passenger jet in eastern Ukraine and expressed grief and sympathy over the tragedy which has claimed 298 lives. In a message to the King of Malaysia, [[Abdul Halim of Kedah|Abdul Halim]], the President said, "I wish to convey my sincere grief and sympathy to the government and people of Malaysia on the crash of the Malaysian Airlines flight in eastern Ukraine yesterday leading to the loss of so many precious lives. Our thoughts and prayers are with the families of the nationals of Malaysia and other countries who lost their lives in this tragic incident".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ndtv.com/article/india/president-pranab-offers-condolences-to-king-of-malaysia-over-mh17-crash-561458|title=President Pranab Offers Condolences to King of Malaysia Over MH17 Crash|work=All India/Press Trust of India|publisher=[[NDTV]]|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=30 July 2014}}</ref> Indian [[Minister of External Affairs (India)|Minister of External Affairs]] [[Sushma Swaraj]] personally wrote to [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Malaysia)|Malaysian Foreign Affairs Minister]] [[Anifah Aman]] to convey that India would stand by the people and government of Malaysia in this difficult time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/News/Nation/2014/07/19/MH17-crash-India-condolences/|title=MH17 crash: India conveys condolences over tragedy|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=30 July 2014}}</ref><ref name="irin"/>
{{flagu|Indonesia}}{{spaced ndash}} Indonesian President [[Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono]] asked that whoever shot down the aircraft be punished unequivocally, and offered to help with the investigation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thejakartaglobe.com/news/sby-calls-action-downed-malaysia-aircraft-tells-indonesian-airliners-avoid-conflict-areas/|title=SBY Calls for Action on Downed Malaysia Aircraft, Tells Indonesian Airliners to Avoid Conflict Areas|work=[[Jakarta Globe]]|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> The Indonesian government has taken a cautious diplomatic stance over Russia's alleged involvement in the downing and the President also had offered his "deep condolences" to Malaysia and the families of the victims.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thejakartaglobe.com/news/indonesia-opts-wait-see-approach-russia-mh17-australia-leads-outrage/|title=Indonesia Opts for Wait-and-See Approach to Russia Over MH17 as Australia Leads Outrage|author=Kennial Caroline Laia|work=Jakarta Globe|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=3 August 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Iran}}{{spaced ndash}} Iranian President [[Hassan Rouhani]] has expressed his deepest sympathy to Malaysian Prime Minister and the Malaysian citizens over the tragic crash. In a message conveyed to Najib, which was made available by the Iranian Embassy in Malaysia, he said "the news of the air crash had caused "deep regret and sorrow". "Undoubtedly, this tragedy and huge grief which covers a lot of nations, highlights the importance of peaceful coexistence and collective action against violence and conflict, in the view of the international community".<ref name="irin">{{cite web|url=http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v7/sp/newssports.php?id=1054805|title=Iranian President, India's PM Express Sympathy To Malaysian Government On MH17 Tragedy|agency=Bernama|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=31 July 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140731053305/http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v7/sp/newssports.php?id=1054805|archivedate=31 July 2014|deadurl=no}}</ref>
{{flagu|Italy}}{{spaced ndash}} Italian President [[Giorgio Napolitano]] is waiting for a "confident, fair and transparent collaborative effort" to clarify the causes of the crash. He added "I have learned with dismay and deep sorrow the news of the tragic disaster that occurred in the Ukrainian sky, determining the loss of so many innocent lives. At this time of mourning, on behalf of the whole Italian people, I offer to families victims the expression of sincere sympathy".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ansabrasil.com.br/brasil/noticias/mundo/noticias/2014/07/18/Napolitano-pede-esclarecimento-queda-aviao_7933723.html|title=Napolitano pede esclarecimento de queda de avião|language=Portuguese|publisher=Ansa Brasil|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> While Foreign Minister [[Federica Mogherini]] in a statement said "I learned with great suffering about the Malaysian Airlines passenger plane's tragedy. Now it is necessary to shed light on what happened as soon as possible through an independent commission of inquiry to get to the truth".<ref name="european"/>
{{flagu|Jamaica}}{{spaced ndash}} The [[Jamaican Senate]] expressed their deepest "sympathies and heartfelt sorrow" for what had taken place and called for an "immediate investigation into the matter". International community also been called to be "more assertive and be more effective" against terrorists.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://loopjamaica.com/2014/07/19/news-senate-sends-condolences-to-malaysian-flights-victims-family/|title=Senate sends condolences to Malaysian flight’s victims’ family|publisher=Loop Jamaica|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Japan}}{{spaced ndash}} According to the [[Chief Cabinet Secretary|Japanese Chief Cabinet Secretary]] [[Yoshihide Suga]], Japan will step up a sanctions against Russia following the downing of the Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ajw.asahi.com/article/behind_news/politics/AJ201407280093|title=Japan to step up sanctions against Russia following Malaysian airliner disaster|agency=Associated Press|work=[[Asahi Shimbun]]|date=28 July 2014|accessdate=29 July 2014}}</ref> Japan also had expressed its sympathies and declared that [[Flag of Japan|Japanese flag]] on its embassy in Malaysia will be fly at half-mast on 22 August.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theborneopost.com/2014/08/21/japan-expresses-sympathies-over-mh17-tragedy-abu-zahar/|title=Japan expresses sympathies over MH17 tragedy — Abu Zahar|agency=Bernama|work=Borneo Post|date=21 August 2014|accessdate=22 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/News/Nation/2014/08/21/MH17-Japanese-flag-half-mast/|title=MH17: Japanese flag will fly at half-mast tomorrow|agency=Bernama|work=The Star|date=21 August 2014|accessdate=22 August 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Kazakhstan}}{{spaced ndash}} Kazakhstani President [[Nursultan Nazarbayev]] expressed his condolences to Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak and Malaysians who lost their loved ones in the crash of the MH17 flight in Ukraine. In his letter to the Malaysian Prime Minister, he "was deeply saddened by the news about the crash of the Malaysian Airlines plane on the territory of Ukraine. On behalf of all Kazakhstanis, he expressed his sincere condolences to Malaysians on their tragic loss".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.tengrinews.kz/politics_sub/Nazarbayev-expresses-condolences-to-Malaysians-MH17-crash-254876/|title=Nazarbayev expresses condolences to Malaysians: MH17 crash|publisher=Tengri News|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Kenya}}{{spaced ndash}} Kenyan President [[Uhuru Kenyatta]] in his Twitter conveyed a condolence message to the people of Malaysia.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/ukenyatta/status/491920642154201088|title=Conveying a condolence message through H.E Ismail Salam to the people of Malaysia following the tragic #MH17 accident|publisher=Uhuru Kenyatta statement on Twitter|date=23 July 2014|accessdate=23 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Kosovo}}{{spaced ndash}} Kosovo’s Foreign Affairs Minister [[Enver Hoxhaj]] condemned what he called a terrorist attack against civilian population and the international community saying that the "Republic of Kosovo strongly supports an international investigation that would clarify the circumstances of this shocking tragedy. Kosovo population stand by the victim families, people and governments in these painful moments of an international tragedy", wrote Mr. Hoxhaj in telegrams sent to his counterparts in the countries whose citizens lost lives in this tragic crash.<ref>{{cite news|title=No Kosovar citizen aboard downed Malaysian plane|url=http://www.mfa-ks.net/?page=2,4,2396|accessdate=27 July 2014|work=Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Kosovo|date=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Laos}}{{spaced ndash}} Laotian Prime Minister [[Thongsing Thammavong]] sent his message of condolences to his Malaysian, Indonesian and Australian counterparts concerning the crash of the aeroplane. While Deputy [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Laos)|Minister of Foreign Affairs]], Saleumxay Kommasith represented the Lao government in expressing the nation's sadness over the Malaysian plane crash in Ukraine during the signing of a condolence book at the Malaysian Embassy in Vientiane. On his statement, "On behalf of the people of Laos, I would like to express my deepest condolences over the tragic accident involving the Malaysian Airlines flight MH 17 that crashed in the east of Ukraine on 17 July 2014, killing all 298 passengers including 43 Malaysian citizens and crew members. I would like to share this moment of sadness and my heartfelt sympathies with the government and people of Malaysia".<ref>{{cite AV media|url=https://www.facebook.com/video.php?v=361022247382753|title=Laos extends condolences over Malaysian Airlines flight MH 17 that crashed in the east of Ukraine on 17 July 2014|medium=video|time=2:42|publisher=[[Lao National Television|LNTV]]|date=22 July 2014|accessdate=22 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Latvia}}{{spaced ndash}} Latvian President [[Andris Bērziņš (Latvian President)|Andris Bērziņš]] urged a thorough and conclusive investigation of the MH17 disaster to pinpoint the perpetrators responsible for the downed passenger airliner. The president called it "a horrific precedent that madmen could just go and murder so many innocent people". He added "the guilty must be punished so that no one would ever again feel the itch to play with such heavy sophisticated weapons without considering the consequences" – "let it loose, see where it hits".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lsm.lv/en/article/politics/president-atrocity-by-madmen-a-horrible-precedent.a92298/|title=Berzins condemns ‘Atrocity by madmen'|publisher=Public Broadcasting of Latvia|date=23 July 2014|accessdate=23 July 2014}}</ref> While [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Latvia)|Latvian Foreign Affairs Minister]] [[Edgars Rinkēvičs]] has banned three popular Russian musicians - [[Oleg Gazmanov]], [[Joseph Kobzon]] and [[Valeriya|Alla Perfilova]] from travelling to Latvia for an indefinite period of time. The decision has been made in accordance with the Immigration Law and Rinkēvičs previously announced that he had decided to ban "apologists of Russian imperialism and aggression from attending "high society" events in Latvia". The ministry's press secretary Karlis Eihenbaums told [[LETA]] that the minister's decision is connected with the events in Ukraine over the past few days, when a passenger plane crashed in eastern Ukraine resulting in 298 casualties.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.delfi.lt/nordic-baltic/protesting-russias-response-to-mh17-crash-latvia-declares-three-pop-singers-personae-non-gratae.d?id=65349606|title=Protesting Russia's response to MH17 crash, Latvia declares three pop singers personae non gratae|work=The Baltic Course|publisher=Delfi|date=21 July 2014|accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Lebanon}}{{spaced ndash}} Lebanon's Foreign Affairs Ministry condemned all terrorist attacks irrespective of their motivation or cause, sending out condolences to the victims of the plane crash.<ref>{{cite news|title=No Lebanese aboard downed Malaysian plane|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Lebanon-News/2014/Jul-19/264446-no-lebanese-aboard-downed-malaysian-plane.ashx|accessdate=27 July 2014|work=The Daily Star|date=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Lithuania}}{{spaced ndash}} Lithuanian President [[Dalia Grybauskaitė]] called the incident a "brutal act of terror and stressed that people behind the tragedy must be clearly identified and brought to justice. It is a brutal act of terror which has shown explicitly that efforts of the international community to solve the crisis in Ukraine have been too weak. It is unjustifiable that in the 21st century Europe innocent people - dozens of children among them - die of weapons. Perpetrators must be named clearly and assume responsibility. Conditions must be established for the international observers to determine the executors and organisers of the tragedy". The Prime Minister [[Algirdas Butkevičius]] also conveyed condolences over the crash, "We are deeply shaken by the event, which killed 298 innocent people including children. The accident would have clearly been prevented, if the conflict in Eastern Ukraine had not been escalated".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.delfi.lt/lithuania/politics/lithuanian-leaders-call-mh17-crash-brutal-act-of-terror.d?id=65333474|title=Lithuanian leaders call MH17 crash "brutal act of terror"|work=TBNS, ELTA|publisher=Delfi|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> While [[Raimonda Murmokaitė]] as the Lithuanian Permanent Representative to the United Nations urged to respect the memory of the victims of the catastrophe of MH17 and condemned any attempts to influence or interfere with the independent investigation conducted by the Dutch Safety Board.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mission-un-ny.mfa.lt/missionny/en/news/at-un-security-council-lithuania-urged-not-to-politicise-independent-investigation-into-downing-of-mh17-1|title=At UN Security Council Lithuania urged not to politicise independent investigation into downing of MH17|publisher=Permanent mission of Lithuania to the United Nations in New York|date=19 September 2014|accessdate=19 September 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Luxembourg}}{{spaced ndash}} Prime Minister [[Xavier Bettel]] expressed his deep sympathy to all the victim families. In his statement on Twitter, he said "I am with my thoughts are with the families and friends of the many innocent victims of the crash of MH17. This terrible incident shocked me deeply and shows the need that we must continue to fight for peace".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lessentiel.lu/de/news/dossier/boeing_ukraine/story/Bettel-spricht-Opfern-von-MH17-sein-Mitgefuehl-aus-24892248|title=Bettel spricht Opfern von MH17 sein Mitgefühl aus|language=German|publisher=[[L'essentiel (newspaper)|L'essentiel]]|date=21 July 2014|accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref> A memorial service has been held on 27 September for all victims on board.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://delano.lu/news/memorial-service-flight-mh17-victims|title=Memorial Service for Flight MH17 Victims|publisher=Delano|date=23 September 2014|accessdate=23 September 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Malaysia}}{{spaced ndash}} Malaysian Deputy Foreign Minister [[Hamzah Zainuddin]] said that the foreign ministry would be working closely with the Russian and Ukrainian governments with regard to the incident.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.cri.cn/12394/2014/07/18/2941s836537.htm|title=Malaysia to Work with Russia, Ukrainian Governments on MH17|publisher=English.cri.cn|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> Prime Minister Najib Razak later said that Malaysia was unable to verify the cause of the crash and demanded that the perpetrators be punished.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.voanews.com/content/malaysian-pm-demands-swift-justice-if-plane-was-shot-down/1960042.html|title=Malaysian PM Demands Swift Justice if Plane Was Shot Down|agency=Reuters|publisher=[[Voice of America]]|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> The [[Government of Malaysia|Malaysian government]] has declared to fly the country [[Flag of Malaysia|national flag]] at [[half-mast]] from 18 July until 21 July.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stasiareport.com/news/asia/south-east-asia/story/malaysia-airlines-mh17-crash-flags-fly-half-mast-over-next-three-day|title=Malaysia Airlines MH17 crash: Flags to fly at half-mast over next three days, says Najib|author=Yong Yen Nie|publisher=Straits Times Asia Report|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Maldives}}{{spaced ndash}} President [[Abdulla Yameen]] sent his condolences to the King of Malaysia and Netherlands as well to Prime Minister Najib and Rutte and all victims families involved.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=11&dcid=14584|title=President sends message of sympathy to the King of Malaysia|publisher=The Presidency, Republic of Maldives|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/?lid=11&dcid=14585|title=President sends message of sympathy to the King of Netherlands|publisher=The Presidency, Republic of Maldives|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Mauritania}}{{spaced ndash}} Mauritanian President [[Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz]] sent a message of condolences to the King of the Netherlands, following the crash in which many Dutch citizens were killed. In his message, "Majesty, It is with great sadness that we learned the crash on 17 July 2014 of the Malaysia Airlines aircraft in which several Dutch citizens were killed. In these painful circumstances, I express to Your Majesty and, through it, to the people, the Government of Dutch and to the families of the victims our sincere condolences and compassion, while ensuring our solidarity in this painful punishment".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rapideinfo.net/index.php/component/content/article/27-admincom/13121-mauritanie-le-president-de-la-republique-adresse-un-message-de-condoleances-au-roi-de-la-hollande-.html|title=Mauritanie: le Président de la République adresse un message de condoléances au Roi de la Hollande|language=French|publisher=Rapide Info|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Mexico}}{{spaced ndash}} The Mexican [[Secretariat of Foreign Affairs (Mexico)|Foreign Minister]] through [[José Antonio Meade Kuribreña|José Antonio Meade]] on behalf of Mexican government expressed their deep shock and sadness.<ref name="latinoamerica"/> In a joint statement of [[MINT (economics)|MIKTA]], the Mexican also strongly condemn the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17 which took the lives of 298 innocent civilians, including many children. They express their deepest condolences to the families of the victims and to the governments and peoples of 12 States whose nationals lost their lives in this heinous act and calls for a full, thorough and independent international investigation into the incident in accordance with international civil aviation guidelines and demands that all military activities in the area cease to allow immediate, safe, secure and unrestricted access to investigating authorities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sre.gob.mx/en/index.php/archived-press-releases/2642-joint-statement-of-the-foreign-ministers-of-mikta-concerning-the-downing-of-malaysia-airlines-flight-mh17|title=Joint Statement of the Foreign Ministers of MIKTA Concerning the Downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17|publisher=[[Secretariat of Foreign Affairs (Mexico)|Secretariat of Foreign Affairs, Mexico]]|date=26 July 2014|accessdate=26 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Moldova}}{{spaced ndash}} Moldovan President [[Nicolae Timofti]] conveyed a message of condolence. In a statement, the President expressed sympathy for the families of the victims of the disaster involving the Malaysia Airlines MH17 aircraft with 298 people on board. "It is with deep regret and sympathy we learned of the tragic plane crash, resulting in numerous casualties. At this time of mourning, on behalf of the Moldovan people and on my own behalf, I express sincere feelings of solidarity and sympathy".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.president.md/eng/presa/presedintele-republicii-moldova-nicolae-timofti-a-transmis-mesaje-de-condoleante-in-legatura-cu-tragicul-accident-aviatic-din-estul-ucrainei-soldat-cu-moartea-a-298-de-persoane|title=Moldovan president sends message of condolences to mourning families of Ukrainian plane|publisher=[[President of Moldova]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Namibia}}{{spaced ndash}} Namibian President [[Hifikepunye Pohamba]] described the shooting down as "tragic". In his condolence message to Malaysian Prime Minister, the president extended his deepest sorrow to the "bereaved families of many nationalities who lost their loved ones". He said "On behalf of the [[Government of Namibia|Government]] and the people of Namibia and indeed on my own behalf, I wish to extend our most sincere condolences to the government and the people of Malaysia and wished the Malaysian government strength as they deal with yet another air tragedy since the disappearance of [[Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370]] on 8 March".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.namibian.com.na/indexx.php?archive_id=125846&page_type=archive_story_detail&page=1|title=Pohamba grieves over flight MH17 victims|publisher=[[The Namibian]]|date=21 July 2014|accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref>
[[File:Convoy of MH-17 victims on the highway.jpg|thumb|Convoy of 40 hearses heading to [[Hilversum]] in the Netherlands, while other traffic stopped]] {{flagu|Netherlands}}{{spaced ndash}} Dutch Prime Minister [[Mark Rutte]] and King [[Willem-Alexander]] voiced their shock at the crash.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/22867019/__Verklaring_Rutte_over_MH17__.html|title=Verklaring premier Rutte over crash MH17 | Binnenland|language=Dutch|work=De Telegraaf|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dc.the-netherlands.org/news/2014/07/statement-king-willem-alexander.html|title=Statement of His Majesty King Willem-Alexander on Malaysian flight MH17 |publisher=The Netherlands Embassy in Washington, D.C., United States|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> Minister of Foreign Affairs [[Frans Timmermans]] will join the Dutch investigation team sent to Ukraine.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.volkskrant.nl/vk/nl/2668/Buitenland/article/detail/3691806/2014/07/18/Timmermans-mee-met-onderzoekers-naar-Oekraine.dhtml|title=Timmermans mee met onderzoekers naar Oekraïne|language=Dutch|publisher=Volkskrant.nl|agency=ANP|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> Dutch government buildings flew the flag at half-mast on 18 July.<ref name="nieuws.nl">{{cite web|url=http://www.nieuws.nl/algemeen/20140717/Vlaggen-overheidsgebouwen-halfstok-na-vliegramp|title=Vlaggen overheidsgebouwen halfstok na vliegramp|language=Dutch|author=Novum|publisher=Nieuws.nl|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> Music was cancelled and festivities were toned down during the last, usually festive, day of the [[Nijmegen Marches]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nieuws.nl/algemeen/20140718/Vierdaagse-schrapt-muziek-wegens-vliegramp|title=Vierdaagse Nijmegen: muziek geschrapt wegens vliegramp|language=Dutch|author=Novum|publisher=nieuws.nl|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> On 21 July the Netherlands officially opened war crimes investigation regarding the downing of the aircraft. The country's prosecutor is said to be already located in Ukraine for that purpose. Rutte also threatened tough action against Russia if it would avoid assistance in the investigation.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://news.yahoo.com/netherlands-opens-investigation-airliner-shoot-down-131650202.html |title=Netherlands opens war crimes investigation into airliner downing |author=Thomas Escritt, Angus MacSwan |date=21 July 2014 |website=[[Yahoo! News]] }}</ref> On 23 July, when the first victims were repatriated, it was a National Day of Mourning in the Netherlands, the first time an official Day of Mourning had been organised in the country since 1962, after [[Wilhelmina of the Netherlands|Queen Wilhelmina]] had died.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/dutch-mourn-first-mh17-bodies-flown-netherlands-113521569--finance.html|title=Dutch mourn as first MH17 bodies arrive in Netherlands|author=Harro Ten Wolde and Thomas Escritt|publisher=Yahoo! News|date=23 July 2014|accessdate=25 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|New Zealand}}{{spaced ndash}} The [[New Zealand Parliament]] has unanimously passed a motion expressing New Zealand's condolences to the families of victims of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17, and criticising those who have impeded investigations into the tragedy. Prime Minister [[John Key]] said "New Zealand called on those groups to co-operate immediately and unreservedly with international authorities, and he urged Russia to use its influence with those groups to ensure the investigation and recovery operation proceeded appropriately and unimpeded. New Zealand was also saddened by the "grievous" casualties borne by other nations, particularly the Netherlands, Malaysia, and Australia".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11297446|title=MH17: Parliament passes motion expressing condolences|author=Adam Bennett|work=[[The New Zealand Herald]]|date=22 July 2014|accessdate=29 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Nigeria}}{{spaced ndash}} Nigeria expressed full support for an independent international investigation into the airline flight disaster in eastern Ukraine. Nigeria's Permanent Representative to the United Nations Professor [[Joy Ogwu]] expressed his country support at an emergency session of the United Nations Security Council. He described the downing of flight MH17 as an "apocalyptic end of the world" and urging the rebels in eastern Ukraine "to co-operate fully and unconditionally with investigations into the crash".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vanguardngr.com/2014/07/downing-flight-mh17-apocalyptic-end-world-nigeria/|title=Downing of flight MH17 an "apocalyptic end of the world’’|publisher=[[Vanguard (Nigeria)|Vanguard]]|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Norway}}{{spaced ndash}} Prime Minister [[Erna Solberg]] during an interview with the [[NRK]] said it was a tragic event. "Our thoughts go out first and foremost to all the families and relatives who have lost their nearest. We have sent our condolences to the Netherlands and Malaysia, where many of the victims came from and I'm saddened by the terrible Malaysian Airlines incident. My thoughts are with all those affected".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newsinenglish.no/2014/07/18/no-norwegians-believed-to-be-on-mh17/|title=No Norwegians on board MH17|author=Emily Woodgate|publisher=NewsinEnglish.no|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Pakistan}}{{spaced ndash}} Prime Minister [[Nawaz Sharif]] sent a letter to his Malaysian counterpart Najib Razak expressing condolences and grief on behalf of the government and people of Pakistan. "In this hour of bereavement and immense grief, the Government and people of Pakistan join me to express our heartfelt condolences and sympathies to the government and people of Malaysia and to the families of all passengers who were on board the unfortunate flight".<ref>{{cite news|title=Nawaz sends message of condolence to Malaysian PM over MH17 crash|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/737527/nawaz-sends-message-of-condolence-to-malaysian-pm-over-mh17-crash/|accessdate=28 July 2014|work=The Express Tribune|date=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Panama}}{{spaced ndash}} The Panaman government conveys its condolences to the families of the victims and calls on the international community for a lasting peace. "Our solidarity and condolences at this difficult time for the Malaysian people and more than nine nations affected by this incident", said the Panamanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs in a statement, which also seeks to "clarify the cause".<ref name="latinoamerica"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://mexico.servidornoticias.com/187_america/2633178_el-gobierno-de-panama-expresa-sus-condolencias-a-los-familiares-de-las-victimas-del-avion-malayo.html|title=El Gobierno de Panamá expresa sus condolencias a los familiares de las víctimas del avión malayo|language=Spanish|work=[[EFE]]|publisher=mexico.servidornoticias.com|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Papua New Guinea}}{{spaced ndash}} Prime Minister [[Peter O'Neill]] has expressed his sorrow and concern at the loss of the flight. On his statement, "The loss of this aircraft has shocked the world, this is a tragic day for people from many nations. Our sympathy and prayers are with the families who now are left to deal with this tragic loss. On behalf of the people of Papua New Guinea, I express my deep condolences to the nations of the passengers. We pray for people in the Netherlands, Malaysia, Australia, Indonesia, the United Kingdom, Germany, Belgium, the Philippines, the United States, Canada and New Zealand who have lost citizens. The cause of the incident must be fully investigated and there needs to be a United Nations-led investigation into the crash of this aircraft, if it is found that this aircraft was brought down by human action, justice must be sought".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.pngfacts.com/2014/07/oneill-expresses-sorrow-confirms-no-png.html|title=O’Neill Expresses Sorrow, Confirms No PNG Citizen On Board MH17 Flight|author=Niugini Nius|work=PNG Today/ Post Courier|publisher=Papua New Guinea Today|date=20 July 2014|accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Philippines}}{{spaced ndash}} The [[Department of Foreign Affairs (Philippines)|Department of Foreign Affairs]] in a statement said "The Philippines condemns in the strongest manner the recent shooting down of Malaysian Airlines flight MH17 over Ukraine. We convey our profound condolences for all who perished in this tragedy and those responsible should be made fully accountable for this unconscionable assault on a non-military aircraft that posed no threat whatsoever to any party".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/07/19/dfa-statement-on-malaysian-airlines-flight-mh17/|title=DFA statement on Malaysian Airlines Flight MH17|publisher=Department of Foreign Affairs, Philippines|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref> The Philippine embassy in Malaysia had fly its [[Flag of the Philippines|flag]] at half-mast on 24 July.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/371868/pinoyabroad/news/phl-embassy-in-kuala-lumpur-flies-flag-at-half-mast-in-remembrance-of-mh17|title=PHL embassy in Kuala Lumpur flies flag at half mast in remembrance of MH17|author=Joel Locsin|work=GMA News|date=24 July 2014|accessdate=25 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Poland}}{{spaced ndash}} President [[Bronisław Komorowski]] described the attack as an "unbelievable and shameful act which is an act of terror". He stressed the parties responsible for the downing of the aeroplane over the eastern territories of Ukraine should be held to account.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thenews.pl/1/10/Artykul/176847,Polish-President-MH17-crash-an-%E2%80%98unbelievable-and-shameful-act%E2%80%99|title=Polish President: MH17 crash an ‘unbelievable and shameful act’|publisher=[[Radio Poland]]|date=22 July 2014|accessdate=22 July 2014}}</ref> The Polish government on 24 July cancelled the "Polish Year in Russia" and "Russian Year in Poland" that were planned for 2015.<ref>[http://www.thenews.pl/1/11/Artykul/177048,Polish-Year-in-Russia-cancelled-following-MH17-catstrophe Polish Year in Russia cancelled following MH17 catastrophe], Thenews.pl, 24 July 2014.</ref><ref>[http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/poland-cancels-year-of-bilateral-celebration-with-russia-over-ukraine/504025.html Poland Cancels Year of Bilateral Celebration With Russia Over Ukraine], ''[[The Moscow Times]]'', 24 July 2014.</ref>
{{flagu|Portugal}}{{spaced ndash}} Portuguese President [[Aníbal Cavaco Silva]] sent his condolences to the families of the 298 people who lost their lives in the Malaysian aeroplane and to all those who "suffered the pain of human loss" as well to the Heads of State of the Netherlands, Malaysia and all countries concerned. The [[Government of Portugal|Portuguese Government]] has issued a statement expressing their condolences to the relatives of the victims and stresses that "the circumstances of this tragedy demand an independent investigation. Therefore we appeals for the full cooperation and information exchange between the parties involved and emphasises that this incident reinforces the need to find a peaceful solution to the territory of eastern Ukraine and the urgency of a ceasefire immediately in the region".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.teinteresa.es/ciencia/presidente-pesame-familias-victimas-Ucrania_0_1177083306.html|title=El presidente luso envía el pésame a familias de las víctimas del avión caído en Ucrania|work=EFE|language=Spanish|publisher=teinteresa.es|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Republic of Ireland}}{{spaced ndash}} The [[Minister for Foreign Affairs and Trade|Irish Minister for Foreign Affairs and Trade]] [[Charles Flanagan]] said in a statement, "Ireland fully supports calls for a full, independent international investigation to establish the cause of this grave tragedy and to ensure that those responsible are swiftly brought to justice".<ref name="ci"/><ref>{{cite press release|title=Statement by Minister Flanagan on the loss of flight MH17 in Ukraine|url=https://www.dfa.ie/news-and-media/press-releases/press-release-archive/2014/july/flanagan-statement-mh17-ukraine/|location=Dublin, Ireland|publisher=[[Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (Ireland)]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Romania}}{{spaced ndash}} Romanian President [[Traian Băsescu]] declared himself "appalled" by the tragic event that occurred in Ukraine's airspace and asked for immediate clarification of the circumstances in which the plane crash occurred. He said EU experts should participate in the investigation along with Ukrainian authorities.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.libertatea.ro/detalii/articol/avion-prabusit-ucraina-reactie-traian-basescu-500380.html |title=REACȚIA lui Traian Băsescu în urma TRAGEDIEI AVIATICE |newspaper=Libertatea |date=17 July 2014 |language=Romanian}}</ref>
[[File:Embassy of Netherlands in Moscow - 1.JPG|thumb|Makeshift memorial at the Embassy of the Netherlands in [[Moscow]], Russia]] {{flagu|Russia}}{{spaced ndash}} Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]] said responsibility for the crash rests with "the country whose airspace the plane was in when it crashed", and that "the disaster wouldn't happen if the military action in south-east of Ukraine was not reenabled".<ref name=telegraph>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/10974050/Malaysia-Airlines-plane-crashes-on-Ukraine-Russia-border-live.html |title=Malaysia Airlines plane crashes on Ukraine-Russia border – live |date=17 July 2014 |first=Harriet |last=Alexander |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |accessdate=17 July 2014|archivedate=18 July 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140718001608/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/10974050/Malaysia-Airlines-plane-crashes-on-Ukraine-Russia-border-live.html}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://ria.ru/society/20140718/1016472533.html|script-title=ru:Путин: за авиакатастрофу несет ответственность Украина |trans-title=Putin: Ukraine responsible for the crash |language=Russian |date=18 July 2014 |agency=RIA Novosti |quote="Безусловно, государство, над территорией которого это произошло, несет ответственность за эту страшную трагедию", – сказал глава РФ |accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref><ref name="biden">{{cite news|url=http://www.msnbc.com/msnbc/biden-malaysia-airlines-crash|publisher=MSNBC|title=Joe Biden: Malaysia Airlines flight ‘apparently’ shot down|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> He further said that it was important to refrain from making any hasty conclusions and politicised statements before the end of the investigation. He said that Russia was ready to provide necessary assistance in organising and carrying out a thorough international inquiry led by ICAO.<ref name=RT-live>{{cite news|title=Malaysia Airlines MH17 plane crash in Ukraine LIVE UPDATES|url=http://rt.com/news/173628-malaysian-plane-crash-ukraine/|accessdate=21 July 2014|publisher=RT|date=17 July 2014}}</ref> On 19 July Russian Ministry of Defence announced "10 questions to the Ukrainian government", repeating accusations earlier published in Russian media.<ref name=RT-live-en>{{cite news|title=Malaysia MH17 crash: 10 questions Russia wants Ukraine to answer|url=http://rt.com/news/173976-mh17-crash-questions-ukraine/|accessdate=21 July 2014|publisher=RT|date=18 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://itar-tass.com/politika/1329235 | title=Минобороны считает заявления Запада по Boeing продолжением информационной войны против РФ | agency=Information Telegraph Agency of Russia | date=19 July 2014 | accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref> Russian citizens brought flowers to the Dutch embassy in Moscow.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.themoscowtimes.com/multimedia/photogalleries/moscow-mourns-victims-of-plane-crash-at-dutch-embassy/5336.html |title=Moscow Mourns Victims of Plane Crash at Dutch Embassy |author= Sergei Karpukhin|work=[[The Moscow Times]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Saudi Arabia}}{{spaced ndash}} Saudi Arabian Ambassador to Malaysia, Fahad A. H. Alrashid expressed sympathy and sadness over the aircraft tragedy. On his statement "I'm sorry about what had happened (to the aircraft) and I hope God will give strength to the families", he said after attending an [[Iftar]] here on 25 July.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v7/ge/newsgeneral.php?id=1056479|title=Saudi Arabia Expresses Sympathy To Malaysia Over MH17 Tragedy|agency=Bernama|date=25 July 2014|accessdate=29 July 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140729091437/http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v7/ge/newsgeneral.php?id=1056479|archivedate=29 July 2014|deadurl=no}}</ref>
{{flagu|Seychelles}}{{spaced ndash}} Seychellois President [[James Michel]] expressed his sincere condolences to the King of the Netherlands, government and people of the Netherlands as well to the Prime Minister of Malaysia and the Malaysian people while describing the attack as "an incomprehensible human tragedy".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.statehouse.gov.sc/news.php?news_id=2529|title=President James Michel offers his prayers and condolences to Holland and Malaysia following aircraft disaster|publisher=[[State House (Seychelles)]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Singapore}}{{spaced ndash}} In a statement by the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Singapore)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]], the Government and people of Singapore send their deepest condolences to the families of the victims of the tragic crash. In their statement, "We stand in solidarity with the Government and people of Malaysia during this difficult period. It is important that a full and transparent investigation take place to establish what caused the crash. The investigation team should be given full access to the affected areas and evidence. We stand ready to offer any possible assistance".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mfa.gov.sg/content/mfa/media_centre/press_room/pr/2014/201407/press_20140718.html|title=MFA Press Statement: Crash of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17|publisher=Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Singapore|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=26 July 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140726054116/http://www.mfa.gov.sg/content/mfa/media_centre/press_room/pr/2014/201407/press_20140718.html|archivedate=26 July 2014|deadurl=no}}</ref>
{{flagu|Slovakia}}{{spaced ndash}} Slovakian President [[Andrej Kiska]] sent letters of condolences to Dutch and Malaysian King. In his condolence letters, the President expressed his deep grief over the tragic fate of the MH17 flight and voiced his heartfelt sympathy with the relatives of the victims. At the same time, he expressed the strong belief that the cause and circumstances of the tragedy would be thoroughly investigated with assistance from international experts without delay. The [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Slovakia)|Foreign Ministry]] also expressed its sincere sympathy with all of those bereaved by the tragedy and urged the respective authorities to secure an independent international probe into the potential causes of the tragedy.<ref name="european"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://spectator.sme.sk/articles/view/54701/10/top_slovak_officials_send_condolences_to_bereaved_of_mh17_plane_crash.html|title=Top Slovak officials send condolences to bereaved of MH17 plane crash|work=TASR, Sme|publisher=[[The Slovak Spectator]]|date=21 July 2014|accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Slovenia}}{{spaced ndash}} The Slovenian [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Slovenia)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] has called for an independent and comprehensive international investigation into the crash of the flight over eastern Ukraine. The foreign ministry said "Only on the basis of such an investigation those responsible for the tragedy could be held accountable".<ref name="european"/>
{{flagu|Solomon Islands}}{{spaced ndash}} Prime Minister [[Gordon Darcy Lilo]] sent his condolences to families of victims of the airline disaster. In a statement, he says "he joins world leaders in expressing sympathy to the families of the victims of MH17, and strongly condemns the horrendous act of terrorism against innocent global citizens. He supports the call of world leaders for an international independent investigation into the gunning down of the plane to find out the perpetrators and those that were found to carry out the unspeakable act must face justice". Adding "the Government and people of Solomon Islands were in shock to learn of the act of terrorism, and join the rest of the world in mourning the loss of the innocent lives on the MH17 flight".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sibconline.com.sb/pm-lilo-sends-condolences-over-mh17-flight-tragedy/|title=PM Lilo sends condolences over MH17 flight tragedy|publisher=[[Solomon Islands Broadcasting Corporation]]|date=20 July 2014|accessdate=20 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|South Africa}}{{spaced ndash}}South African [[Minister of International Relations and Cooperation]] [[Maite Nkoana-Mashabane]] urged world leaders not to jump to conclusions on the incident.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ewn.co.za/2014/07/18/Dirco-investigating-SA-linked-MH17-victims|title=Govt investigating SA linked MH17 victims|date=18 July 2014|publisher=Eyewitness News|author1=Mia Lindeque|author2= Arne Doornebal|editor=Craig Wynn|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> [[President of South Africa|President]] [[Jacob Zuma]] sent a message of condolence to Malaysia and called for independent investigation, saying: "We also extend our sympathies to the Government and the people of Malaysia, as well as all countries that have lost their citizens in the tragic crash. South Africa calls for a thorough, transparent and independent investigation to determine the cause of the incident".<ref>{{cite press release |title=President Zuma sends a message of condolences following MH17 crash |url=http://www.dirco.gov.za/docs/2014/mala0718.html |location=Pretoria |publisher=Department of International Relations and Cooperation |date=18 July 2014 |accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|South Korea}}{{spaced ndash}} South Korean President [[Park Geun-hye]] sent a messages of condolence to Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak and Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte concerning the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17. The President expressed her condolences and sympathy for the victims and members of the bereaved families and hope that in the near future the Dutch and Malaysian people will be able to overcome this shock and sadness.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.korea.net/NewsFocus/Policies/view?articleId=120683|title=President sends condolences to plane crash families|author1=Wi Tack-whan|author2=Yoon Sojung|publisher=[[Korea.net]]|date=21 July 2014|accessdate=29 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Spain}}{{spaced ndash}} Spanish Prime Minister [[Mariano Rajoy]] said in a statement "the world has a right to know" who fired the missile that brought down Malaysia Airlines plane in pro-Russian separatist territory in eastern Ukraine, the world has a right to know who carried out this "barbaric act" and the world has a right to know what has happened and everybody will have to do everything possible to make sure that a savage act like this doesn't happen again". Earlier the Spanish [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation (Spain)|Foreign Ministry]] expressed its condolences and said it shared the pain of families and loved ones of the 298 victims. Spain hopes an investigation can explain the circumstances of the accident as quickly as possible and we urged the parties involved to participate fully in the investigation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thelocal.es/20140718/spain-malaysia-russia-ukraine-plane-crash|title=Spain calls for answers on Malaysian jet crash|publisher=The Local|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Sri Lanka}}{{spaced ndash}} Sri Lankan President [[Mahinda Rajapaksa]] has conveyed condolences via Twitter to families on the loss of loved ones on Malaysian Airlines Flight MH17. On his statement "Please convey my condolences to the people of Malaysia on the loss of loved ones on Malaysian Airlines Flight MH17". He also added that "I also want to send out my condolences and that of the Sri Lankan people to all other families suffering from the loss of a loved one on MH17". In a statement released by the [[Ministry of External Affairs (Sri Lanka)|Sri Lankan Ministry of External Affairs]], "The government together with the people of Sri Lanka convey heartfelt condolences and deepest sympathies to the families of the passengers and the crew who were on board the flight, and express solidarity with those nations whose citizens perished in this appalling incident".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/world/2014-07/21/c_133500199.htm|title=Sri Lankan president expresses condolences over MH17|author=Fu Peng|publisher=English.news.cn|date=21 July 2014|accessdate=29 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Suriname}}{{spaced ndash}} Surinamese President [[Desi Bouterse]] sent a message of condolence to the Dutch government and expressed his condolences and sympathy for the victims and members of the bereaved families concerning the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17. Schools and members of the Surinamese government signed the book of condolences at the Dutch embassy. Six of the victims were [[Surinamese people in the Netherlands|Dutch nationals of Surinamese origin]] including a newly wed [[Indo-Surinamese|Indo Surinamese]] couple and four members of the [[Javanese Surinamese|Javanese Surinamese diaspora community]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.waterkant.net/suriname/2014/07/24/condoleanceregister-voor-slachtoffers-mh17-geopend-in-paramaribo/comment-page-2/|title=Condoleanceregister voor slachtoffers MH17 geopend in Paramaribo|language=Dutch|publisher=waterkant.net|date=24 July 2014|accessdate=24 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Sweden}}{{spaced ndash}} Prime Minister [[Fredrik Reinfeldt]] on behalf of the [[Government of Sweden|Swedish government]] sent a condolence letter to Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak and Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte. The Swedish flag has been declared at half-mast on 23 July at the Swedish embassy in The Hague, the Netherlands.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.swedenabroad.com/Pages/StandardPage.aspx?id=77497&epslanguage=sv-SE|title=Flaggan på halvstång på den nationella sorgedagen|language=Swedish|publisher=Sweden Embassy in The Hague, the Netherlands|date=24 July 2014|accessdate=24 July 2014}}</ref> While Swedish Foreign Minister [[Carl Bildt]] described the shot down as "an act by international [[gangsters]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.swedishwire.com/politics/19485-a-first-class-international-gangster-crime-swedens-foreign-minister-carl-bildt-|title='A first class international gangster crime': Sweden's foreign minister Carl Bildt|author=Johan Nylander|publisher=The Swedish Wire|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Tajikistan}}{{spaced ndash}} Tajikistani President [[Emomali Rahmon]] expressed his condolences to Malaysian Prime Minister and to the King of the Netherlands over the crash of the aeroplane. On his statement, he told "the people of Tajikistan are very saddened to hear the news about the terrible tragedy of Malaysia Airlines Boeing-777 that happened over Ukraine and led to numerous casualties. I express my deepest condolences to the friendly and brotherly people of Malaysia and ask you to pass my most sincere words of compassion and support to the families and friends of the victims". While in his condolences telegram to the Dutch King, he expressed the most sincere condolences to the large number of Dutch people.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.avesta.tj/eng/goverment/3786-president-rahmon-expresses-condolences-to-malaysian-prime-minister-king-of-netherlands.html|title=President Rahmon Expresses Condolences to Malaysian Prime Minister, King of Netherlands|publisher=avesta.tj|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Tanzania}}{{spaced ndash}} Tanzanian President [[Jakaya Kikwete]] sent a condolence message to Malaysian Prime Minister. In a statement, he said "I have learnt with great shock and sorrow the sad news of the loss of so many lives due to the crash of a Malaysian airliner on its way from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that occurred on Ukrainian territory on Thursday 17th July 2014. The crash is an immense tragedy not only for the loved ones of those who perished but also for all the people of Malaysia and their friends. As a country, our thoughts and prayers are with the people of Malaysia in this time of grief. On behalf of the [[Government of Tanzania|Government]] and the people of Tanzania, and indeed on my own behalf, I offer you our sincere condolences, support and solidarity".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://foreigntanzania.blogspot.co.uk/2014/07/press-release_18.html|title=Press release|publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Co-operation (Tanzania)]]|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Thailand}}{{spaced ndash}} The [[National Council for Peace and Order]] (NCPO) head General [[Prayuth Chan-ocha]] on a statement expressed its condolences to the countries impacted by the Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 crash in Ukraine. On behalf of the Thai government, he extended his condolences to world leaders who suffered the loss of their people and to the families of the many victims. He added "Thailand stands in solidarity with the peoples and governments of the crash victims at this difficult time. Thailand also demands an independent and transparent investigation into the incident and is ready to provide assistance to the international community".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thainews.prd.go.th/CenterWeb/NewsEN/NewsDetail?NT01_NewsID=WNPOL5707210010006|title=NCPO extends condolences to families of plane crash victims|author=Rodney McNeil|publisher=National News Bureau of Thailand|date=21 July 2014|accessdate=26 July 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140726051413/http://thainews.prd.go.th/CenterWeb/NewsEN/NewsDetail?NT01_NewsID=WNPOL5707210010006|archivedate=26 July 2014|deadurl=no}}</ref>
{{flagu|The Gambia}}{{spaced ndash}} Gambian ambassador to Malaysia Jobe-Njie representing the Gambian President and the Gambian people conveyed her sympathies over the tragic accidents that marred the Malaysian national air carrier.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://observer.gm/africa/gambia/article/gambian-diplomat-presents-credentials-to-malaysian-king|title=Gambian diplomat presents credentials to Malaysian King|publisher=[[The Daily Observer]]|date=2 December 2014|accessdate=17 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mofa.gov.gm/node/111|title=The Gambia’s Ambassador To The Kingdom Of Malaysia, Fatou Mass Jobe-Njie Has Recently Presented Her letters Of Credence To The King of Malaysia|author=Asanneh|publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (The Gambia)]]|date=12 February 2015|accessdate=17 February 2015}}</ref>
{{flagu|Trinidad and Tobago}}{{spaced ndash}} Prime Minister [[Kamla Persad-Bissessar]] in a statement express her condolence, in her statement, she said "It is with great sadness that I learnt of the tragedy of Malaysia Airlines flight MH 17 on 17 July 2014 in which 289 persons lost their lives, among which 189 are reported to be Dutch nationals, 44 citizens of Malaysia, 27 from Australia and others from Indonesia, the United Kingdom, Germany, Belgium, the Philippines, Canada and New Zealand. On behalf of the Government and People of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, I extend deep condolences to the Governments and Peoples of these countries on the loss of their loved ones - family members, friends and colleagues. I enjoin our prayers to theirs and trust that our expression of solidarity will strengthen their spirit at this very challenging moment".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foreign.gov.tt/site_media/media/docs/foreign-affairs-insight-issue-3-2014.pdf|title=Statement by the Honourable Kamla Persad-Bissessar S.C., Prime Minister of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago on the crash of Malaysian Airlines on July 17, 2014|publisher=[[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Trinidad and Tobago)]]|date=22 August 2014|accessdate=22 August 2014|issue=3|page=4|format=[[PDF]]}}</ref>
{{flagu|Turkey}}{{spaced ndash}} Turkish President [[Abdullah Gül]] has offered his condolences to the Dutch and Malaysian King.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/gundem/26844825.asp|title=Gül'den Hollanda ve Malezya Krallını'na taziye mesajları|language=Turkish|work=DHA|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=1 August 2014}}</ref> The Turkish Foreign Ministry called the plane crash an act of terrorism that requires thorough investigation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.ria.ru/world/20140719/191036685/Turkey-Says-MH-17-Crash-in-Ukraine-Act-of-Terrorism-Calls-for.html|title=Turkey Says MH 17 Crash in Ukraine 'Act of Terrorism,' Calls for Investigation|author=Andrei Stenin|agency=RIA Novosti|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=26 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Turkmenistan}}{{spaced ndash}} Turkmen President [[Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedow]] sent condolences to Malaysian Prime Minister, Dutch King and Australian Governor-General over the plane crash, which resulted in deaths of the passengers most of whom were citizens of these countries. On his statement, he told "On behalf of the Turkmenistan's people and the [[Government of Turkmenistan|Government]], I expressed deep sympathy and support to the families and friends of the victims".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.akipress.com/news:544886/|title=President of Turkmenistan expresses condolences over Malaysia Airlines plane crash|publisher=AKIpress|date=21 July 2014|accessdate=21 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|Ukraine}}{{spaced ndash}} Ukrainian President [[Petro Poroshenko]] vowed support for a Dutch probe into the crash, which he called an act of terrorism. He offered condolences for the air disaster in a telephone conversation with Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/10974784/Malaysia-Airlines-crash-President-Poroshenko-calls-shooting-down-of-Malaysian-plane-an-act-of-terrorism.html|work=The Daily Telegraph|title=Malaysia Airlines crash: President Poroshenko calls shooting down of Malaysian plane an 'act of terrorism'|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> Ukrainian citizens brought flowers to the Dutch and Malaysian embassies in Kiev in support.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/malaysian-airlines-flight-mh17-ukrainians-pay-tribute-dutch-embassy-kiev-1632196|title=Malaysian Airlines Flight MH17: Ukrainians Pay Tribute at Dutch Embassy in Kiev|author=Dennis Lynch|work=International Business Times|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.demotix.com/news/5292361/tributes-laid-kievs-dutch-and-malaysian-embassy-after-plane-crash#media-5292237|title=Tributes laid at Kiev's Dutch and Malaysian Embassy after plane crash|author=Julia Kochetova|publisher=Demotix|date=17 July 2014|accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref>
{{flagu|United Arab Emirates}}{{spaced ndash}} UAE President Sheikh [[Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan]] sent a message of condolence to the Malaysian King Tuanku Abdul Halim Mu'adzam Shah on the tragedy. UAE Vice-President and Prime Minister and Ruler of Dubai Sheikh [[Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum]] and Abu Dhabi Crown Prince and Deputy Supreme Commander of the UAE Armed Forces General Sheikh [[Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan]] also sent similar messages of condolences to Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nst.com.my/node/15041|title=MH17: UAE president conveys condolences to King|agency=Bernama|work=[[New Straits Times]]|date=19 July 2014|accessdate=29 July 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140729092612/http://www.nst.com.my/node/15041|archivedate=29 July 2014|deadurl=no}}</ref> The UAE Disaster Victims Identification (DVI) have been sent to take part in identifying the remains of victims killed in the downing of the aircraft.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.emirates247.com/news/uae-team-to-help-identify-victims-of-downed-malaysian-mh17-2014-07-25-1.557619|title=UAE team to help identify victims of downed Malaysian MH17|publisher=[[Emirates 24/7]]|date=25 July 2014|accessdate=29 July 2014}}</ref>
[[File:For those lost on Flight MH 17 (14724657094).jpg|thumb|Flags flying half-mast at [[Downing Street]], London]] {{flagu|United Kingdom}}{{spaced ndash}} The British government requested an emergency meeting of the [[United Nations Security Council]] and called an emergency [[Cabinet Office Briefing Room|Cobra]] meeting after the incident.<ref>{{cite news|title=MH17 crash in Ukraine|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-28358968|publisher=BBC|date=18 July 2014}}</ref> Prime Minister [[David Cameron]] said he was "shocked and saddened by the Malaysian air disaster",<ref>{{cite news|title=Cameron 'shocked and saddened' by plane crash|url=http://www.itv.com/news/update/2014-07-17/cameron-shocked-and-saddened-by-plane-crash/|publisher=ITV News|date=24 July 2014}}</ref> and that "those responsible must be brought to account".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/10975874/MH17-plane-crash-David-Cameron-urges-those-responsible-for-downing-jet-to-be-held-to-account.html|title=MH17 plane crash: David Cameron urges those responsible for downing jet to be 'held to account'|work=The Telegraph|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref> The [[Department for Transport]] ordered "flights already airborne" to bypass south-eastern regions of the country.<ref>{{cite news|title=Flights rerouted: Planes avoiding Ukraine airspace after Malaysia Airlines crash|url=http://rt.com/news/173652-fights-avoid-ukrain-malaysian/|publisher=RT|date=17 July 2014}}</ref>
[[File:Chuck Hagel signs condolence book MH17 (2).jpg|thumb|United States Secretary of Defense [[Chuck Hagel]] signs a condolence book in the Netherlands embassy in Washington D.C.]] {{flagu|United States}}{{spaced ndash}} US President Barack Obama said the US would help determine the cause.<ref name="telegraph"/> In a press statement, White House spokesman [[Josh Earnest]] called for an immediate ceasefire in Ukraine to allow for a full investigation.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Mason|first1=Jeff|last2=Holland|first2=Steve|title=White House urges Ukraine ceasefire for plane probe, Obama {{Refimprove|date=February 2013}} '''Intrinsic fraud''' is an intentionally false representation that goes to the heart of what a given lawsuit is about, in other words, whether fraud was used to procure the transaction. (If the transaction was fraudulent, it probably does not have the legal status of a contract.) Intrinsic fraud is distinguished from extrinsic fraud (a/k/a collateral fraud) which is a deceptive means of keeping a person from discovering and/or enforcing legal rights. It is possible to have either intrinsic or extrinsic frauds, or both.
During a [[trial]], [[perjury]], [[forgery]], and [[bribery]] of a [[witness]] constitute [[fraud]]s that might have been relieved by the [[court]]. Such actions will usually lead to a [[mistrial (law)|mistrial]] being declared and after any penalties for the involved parties a new trial will take place on the same matter.
Two types of intrinsic fraud in contract law are ''fraud in the inducement'' and ''fraud in the factum''.
''Fraud in the factum'' is a [[law|legal]] defense, and occurs where A signs a contract, but either does not realize that it is a contract or does not understand the nature of the contract, because of some false information that B gave to A. ''For example,'' if John tells his mother that he is taking a college course on handwriting analysis, and for his homework, he needs her to read and sign a pretend deed. If Mom signs the deed believing what he told her, and John tries to enforce the deed, Mom can plead "fraud in the factum."
''Fraud in the inducement'' is an [[equity (law)|equitable]] defense, and occurs when A signs a contract, knowing that it is a contract and (at least having a rough idea) what the contract is about, but the reason A signed the contract was because of some false information that B gave to A. ''For example,'' if John tells his mother to sign a deed giving him her property, Mom refuses at first, then John explains that the deed will be kept in a safe deposit box until she dies. If Mom signs the deed because of this statement from John, and John tries to enforce the deed prior to Mom's death, Mom can plead "fraud in the inducement."
